vectigal: <entryFree id="n50285" type="main" key="vecti_gal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vectīgal</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype> (<sense id="n50285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> vectigaliorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:101" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 49</bibl></cit>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vectus, from veho</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a toll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impost</hi> paid to the State (cf.: tributum, census, stipendium). </sense><sense id="n50285.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vectigalibus non solum adventus mali, sed etiam metus ipse affert calamitatem ... ita neque ex portu neque ex decumis neque ex scripturā vectigal conservari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; C. Gracch. ap. Gell 11, 10, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B C 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pensitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Imp Pomp. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imponere agro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:21:55 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 21, 55 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levare agrum vectigali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:36:136" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 36, 136</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50285.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">an honorarium</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contribution paid to a magistrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 11</bibl></cit>: aedilicium, <hi rend="ital">the contribution of a province to the games instituted by an œdile</hi>, id. Q. Fr, 1, 1, 9, § 26.—</sense><sense id="n50285.3" n="II" level="1"> Transf, of private affairs, <hi rend="ital">revenue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">income</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalia urbana rusticis (anteponantur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:25:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 25, 88</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex meo tenui vectigali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 3, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 40</bibl>; Col. praef. § 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 54, 79, § 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:15" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 3, 8, § 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:18:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 18, 2 sq.</bibl>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum vectigal est Parsimonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 3, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vectigaliarius: <entryFree id="n50286" type="main" key="vecti_ga_li^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vectīgālĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <sense id="n50286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">m</hi> [vectigal], <hi rend="ital">a collector</hi> or <hi rend="ital">receiver of taxes</hi>: publicani et vectigaliarii, Firm. Math. 3, 13.</sense></entryFree>
vectigalis: <entryFree id="n50287" type="main" key="vecti_ga_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vectīgālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n50287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj</hi> [id.]. </sense><sense id="n50287.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to imposts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">taxes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>impost</tr>, <tr>tribute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:35:section=89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 35, § 89</bibl></cit>, cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">annuum tributum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50287.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Paying tribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subject to imposts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tributary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:34:section=79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 34, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 43</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">103: hos Suevi ... vectigales sibi fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hannibal) vectigalis stipendiariusque et servus populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 41, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50287.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the revenue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that brings in revenue</hi> or <hi rend="ital">income</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos vectigales tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ei lecti sui contumelia vectigalis est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 323, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 18</bibl></cit>: quadrigae, Ascon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:in Tog. Caud. p. 94:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. in Tog. Caud. p. 94, 14</bibl> Bait.</sense></entryFree>
vectio: <entryFree id="n50288" type="hapax" key="vecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>veho</etym>, <sense id="n50288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveyance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupedum vectiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 151</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vectis: <entryFree id="n50289" type="main" key="vectis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vectis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>acc.</case> vectim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:32:153" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 32, 153</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> vecti, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 766</bibl>; Serv. ad <cb n="VECT" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 469</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vectigal</etym>, <sense id="n50289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a strong pole</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bar;</hi> esp., </sense><sense id="n50289.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A lever</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa quam maxima possunt vectibus promovent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 19</bibl>.—In a trial of strength: <cit><quote lang="la">(Pompeius) cum alacribus saltu, cum velocibus cursu, cum validis vecte certabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 11</bibl></cit> dub. Dietsch <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> —</sense><sense id="n50289.2" n="2" level="3"> For moving machines, <hi rend="ital">a handspike</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50289.3" n="3" level="3"> For carrying, <hi rend="ital">a carryingpole</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 571</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50289.4" n="4" level="3"> For breaking up or tearing down any thing, <hi rend="ital">a crow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crow-bar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">demoliri signum ac vectibus labefactare conantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 26, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vecte in pectus adacto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 452</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50289.5" n="5" level="3"> For fastening a door, <hi rend="ital">a bar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bolt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad eum (conjectorem) retulisset quasi ostentum, quod anguis domi vectem circumjectus fuisset: tum esset, inquit, ostentum, si anguem vectis circumplicavisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:28:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 28, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 609</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 125</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50290" type="main" key="Vectis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vectis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island south of Britain</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Isle of Wight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 16, 30, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vec-ta</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, Eutr 7, 19.</sense></entryFree>
vectitatus: <entryFree id="n50291" type="main" key="vecti^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vectĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [vectito, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:6:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 6, 3</bibl>; Caper, p. 2246 P.], <sense id="n50291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">borne</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carried about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">curru quadrijugo vectitatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 183</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 11, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vectius: <entryFree id="n50292" type="main" key="Vecti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vectĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 83, 85, § 199</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vecto: <entryFree id="n50293" type="main" key="vecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vecto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n50293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. a</hi> [veho], <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convey</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">delphinum dorso super fluctus edito vectavisse (Arionem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:19:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 19, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora viva nefas Stygiā vectare carinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaustris ornos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saucia corpora vectet aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit> (4, 2), 46; cf. v. 39.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be carried</hi> or <hi rend="ital">borne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ride</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectabor umeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:74" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectari equis,</quote> <trans><tr>to ride on horseback</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 374</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 22</bibl>: octophoro, App Mag. p. 323.</sense></entryFree>
vectones: <entryFree id="n50294" type="main" key="Vecto_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vectōnes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vettōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Lusitania</hi>, in the modern <hi rend="ital">Salamanca</hi> and <hi rend="ital">Estremadura</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:112" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 20, 34, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 38</bibl>; Liv 35, 22, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:378" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 378</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vet-tōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the territory of the Vettones</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 3, 187; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 383, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vector: <entryFree id="n50295" type="main" key="vector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>veho</etym>. <sense id="n50295.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one that bears</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carries</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">conveys</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">a bearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carrier</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose); (equus) gradarius optimu' vector, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 17, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sileni (asellus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:433" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellae (taurus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 553" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stelligeri Olympi (Atlas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 1907" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1907</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vector meus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>my horse</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>, p. 140.—</sense><sense id="n50295.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one that rides upon</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">a rider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traveller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passenger</hi> (class.); <cit><quote lang="la">on a ship: etiam summi gubernatores in magnis tempestatibus a vectoribus admoneri solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingratis vectoribus bene gubernare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 581</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animosius a mercatore quam a vectore solvitur votum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 73:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 73, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:85:35" default="NO">85, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:9:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 9, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— In mal. part.: numquam nisi navi plenā tollo vectorem, Macr S. 2, 5.—On horseback, <hi rend="ital">a rider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horseman</hi>: vector equum regit, Ov A. A. 3, 555; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 7, 84.</sense></entryFree>
vectorius: <entryFree id="n50296" type="main" key="vecto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vectōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n50296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for carrying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigia,</quote> <trans><tr>transport-ships</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 8</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:63" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vectrix: <entryFree id="n50297" type="main" key="vectrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vectrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vector, I.</etym>, <sense id="n50297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that carries</hi> or <hi rend="ital">transports</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 49, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: equa, Poët. ap. Anth. Lat. Burm. 1, p 628.</sense></entryFree>
vectura: <entryFree id="n50298" type="main" key="vectu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vectūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>veho</etym>, <sense id="n50298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carrying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transportation</hi> by carriage or by ship; <hi rend="ital">a riding</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n50298.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">equi idonei ad vecturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misimus qui pro vecturā solveret,</quote> <trans><tr>for the transportation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: mercium. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:9:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 9, 4</bibl>: sine vecturae periculo. <hi rend="ital">of transportation by sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 4</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">remiges, arma, frumenta, vecturae imperabantur,</quote> <trans><tr>transport</tr>, <tr>conveyance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vecturas frumenti finitimis civitatibus descripsit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50298.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">passage-money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">freight-money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">freight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:15:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 101, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vecturarius: <entryFree id="n50299" type="main" key="vectu_ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vectūrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vectura</etym>, <sense id="n50299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a driver</hi> of a vehicle, Cod. Th. 14, 6, 1. <pb n="1962" /> <cb n="VEHE" /></sense></entryFree>
vectus: <entryFree id="n50300" type="main" key="vectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of veho.</entryFree>
vedius: <entryFree id="n50301" type="main" key="Ve_di^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vēdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n50301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens: <cit><quote lang="la">Vedius Pollio, notorious for his cruelty to his slaves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:40:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 40, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:18:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Clem. 1, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:77 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 23, 39, § 77 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50302" type="main" key="Ve_di_us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vēdīus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name for</hi> Vejovis, q. v., <hi rend="ital">Pluto</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 166</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veemens: <entryFree id="n50303" type="main" key="ve^e^mens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕĕmens</orth>, v. vehemens.</entryFree>
vegeo: <entryFree id="n50304" type="main" key="ve^ge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕgĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. ugras, strong; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(gih/s</foreign>, healthful; cf. vigeo, vigor; augeo, vigil</etym>. <sense id="n50304.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quicken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arouse</hi> (ante-class.): aequora salsa veges ingentibu' ventis, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 183, 3</bibl> (Com. v. 2, p. 153 Vahl.): cum magno strepitu Volcanum ventu' vegebat, id. ap. Fest. s. v. metonymia, p. 153 Müll. (Ann. v. 477 Vahl.): animos Venus veget voluptatibus, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 183, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50304.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be lively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">active</hi>: viget, veget utpote plurimum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 183, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vegetabilis: <entryFree id="n50305" type="main" key="ve^ge^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕgĕtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vegeto</etym>, <sense id="n50305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">animating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enlivening</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">flabra Favonii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 694</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam radix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vegetamen: <entryFree id="n50306" type="main" key="ve^ge^ta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕgĕtāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the animating power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vivifying principle</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrae vegetamina vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 299</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vegetatio: <entryFree id="n50307" type="hapax" key="ve^ge^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕgĕtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enlivening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excitement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incessus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 102, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vegetator: <entryFree id="n50308" type="main" key="ve^ge^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕgĕtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enlivener</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exciter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickener</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inertum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ephem. in Orat. 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Orient. Trin. 35: irrequies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 5, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vegetius: <entryFree id="n50309" type="main" key="Ve^ge^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕgĕtĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50309.1" n="I" level="1"> Flavius Vegetius Renatus, <hi rend="ital">a writer on military affairs in the latter half of the fourth century.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n50309.2" n="II" level="1"> P. Vegetius, <hi rend="ital">a later writer</hi> De Re Veterinariā; cf. Teuffel, Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Gesch. § 424.</sense></entryFree>
vegeto: <entryFree id="n50310" type="main" key="ve^ge^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕgĕto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vegetus</etym>, <sense id="n50310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to arouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enliven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quicken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">animate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invigorate</hi> (post-class.): spiritus, qui animalia omnia vitali et fecundā ope vegetat, App. de Mundo, p. 61, 36; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 11, p. 257</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ascl. 92, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">structum Adam (anima),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 448</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cath. 10, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima carnem vegetat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudia non illum vegetent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 25, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriae vegetandae gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vegetus: <entryFree id="n50311" type="main" key="ve^ge^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕgĕtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vegeo</etym>, <sense id="n50311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">enlivened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">animated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">active</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brisk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprightly</hi> (class.; cf.: acer, alacer, valens). </sense><sense id="n50311.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">te vegetum nobis in Graeciā siste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessi cum recentibus ac vegetis pugnabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:47:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 47, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vegetus praescripta ad munia surgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigris vegetisque oculis, valetudine prosperā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vegetior ab inferis recurrit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 181, 32</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vegetior aspectus (tauri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vegetissimus color conchyliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 8, 22, § 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50311.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed vegetum ingenium in vivido pectore vigebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertia pars rationis et mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 29, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 459" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gustus,</quote> <trans><tr>keen</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Eph. Ord. Cog. 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc intervallum temporis vegetissimum agricolis maximeque operosum est,</quote> <trans><tr>the liveliest</tr>, <tr>busiest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 65, § 238</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vegrandis: <entryFree id="n50312" type="main" key="ve_grandis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vē-grandis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n50312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not very large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminutive</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">oves vegrandes atque imbecillae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">farra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:445" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 445</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=372" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 372</bibl></cit>: gradus, Plaut. Fragm. ib.—</sense><sense id="n50312.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Very great</hi>, = valde grandis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 183, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non idcirco extollitur, nec vitae vegrandi datur, Lucil. ap. Non. l. l. (Sat. 26, 35): homo vegrandi macie torridus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 34, 93</bibl></cit> (dub. Zumpt; B. and K. ut grandi).</sense></entryFree>
vehatio: <entryFree id="n50313" type="hapax" key="ve^ha_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕhātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>veho</etym>, <sense id="n50313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transportation</hi>, Cod. Th. 14, 6, 3 (perh. vectatio should be read).</sense></entryFree>
vehemens: <entryFree id="n50314" type="main" key="ve^he^mens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕhĕmens</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">veemens</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 120</bibl> K. and H.; more freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">vēmens</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:50:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 50, 21</bibl>; and Lucr. always, Lachm., Munro), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perh. Sanscr. vahis, out of, and mens; cf. vē-</etym>, <sense id="n50314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very eager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ardent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehement</hi>, etc. (syn. violentus). </sense><sense id="n50314.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehemens in utramque partem, Menedeme, es nimis, Aut largitate nimiā aut parsimoniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galba non in agendo solum, sed etiam in meditando vehemens atque incensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 22, 88</bibl></cit>: in alios, id. Sull. <cb n="VEHI" /> 31, 87: <cit><quote lang="la">vehemens feroxque naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with severus (opp. lenissimus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with inexorabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:31:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 31, 87</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with dissolutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:40:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 40, § 104</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with acer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 10, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with fortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 28, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehemens lupus et sibi et hosti Iratus pariter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of abstract things: <cit><quote lang="la">acer et vehemens incitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:43:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 43, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus orationis vehemens atque atrox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 49, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehemens et pugnax exordium dicendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 78, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehemens et aspera quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:113" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehemens et grave senatusconsultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50314.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">active</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forcible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mighty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis vemens causa ad objurgandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arcturus signum sum omnium acerrimum: Vehemens sum exoriens: quom occido vehementior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 517</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementior cursus fluminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementissimus cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:15" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:ib. 8:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilum ... vehementius ictu missuque telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brassica ... tenui suco vehementissima,</quote> <trans><tr>very powerful</tr>, <tr>very efficacious</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum efficacius et vehementius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 70" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis vehementioribus statuminibus impedanda est,</quote> <trans><tr>stronger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:16:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis vehemens multaque materia frondens,</quote> <trans><tr>vigorous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <trans><tr>thick</tr>, <tr>stout</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:12:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violentia vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 482</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis frigorum aut calorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 235</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vis in oratione vehementissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementior lethargus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 87, § 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 9, 38, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus strigilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum vehementius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:6:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conviva salibus vehemens intra pomoeria natis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vehementer: <entryFree id="n50315" type="main" key="ve^he^menter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕhĕmenter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vēmenter</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>vehemens</etym>. <sense id="n50315.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to vehemens, I.) <hi rend="ital">Eagerly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetuously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ardently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earnestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemently</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementer irata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos credere hoc mihi vehementer velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vehementer, acriter, animose fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:23:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 23, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementer eos incusavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commotus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 37</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insectari aliquem vehementius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi alicui vehementius minari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66, § 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementius equos incitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 41</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementissime contendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proeliari, Auct. B. G. 8, 30: vehementissime sibi animum ad virtutem adcendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 4, 5</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50315.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to vehemens, II.) <hi rend="ital">Strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forcibly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceedingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extremely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctuare video vehementer mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astringere manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementer id retinebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:32:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 32, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc te vehementer etiam atque etiam rogo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, D: <cit><quote lang="la">displicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod vehementer ad has res Attinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 29</bibl></cit>: (res) vehementer ad me pertinet, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium vehementer effugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:823" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 823</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingemere vehementer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:12:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 12, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se vehementissime exercere in aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 152</bibl></cit>: probare, Licin. Calv. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 198</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
vehementesco: <entryFree id="n50316" type="main" key="ve^he^mentesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕhĕmentesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n50316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to become violent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vehement</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">passio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:2:51" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 2, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:6:92" default="NO">2, 6, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 4:6:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 91</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vehementia: <entryFree id="n50317" type="main" key="ve^he^menti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕhĕmentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (post-Aug.). <sense id="n50317.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Eagerness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fervency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehemence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pollio Asinius fuit acris vehementiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gracchi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50317.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Strength</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 8, 16, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 5, 27, § 88</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 21, § 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a strong pulse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 24, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linteorum strigilumque,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a copious use</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 4, 14, § 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50317.2" n="B" level="2"> Of language: <cit><quote lang="la">inter hujus generis et illius superioris vehementiam hoc interest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 19, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vehes: <entryFree id="n50318" type="main" key="ve^hes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕhes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>veho</etym>, <sense id="n50318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carriage loaded</hi> with any thing, <hi rend="ital">a cart-load</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wagon-load</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n50318.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">faeni large onusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stercoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:86" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 23, 53, § 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui lapis etiam nunc ostenditur magnitudine vehis,</quote> <trans><tr>so big as to be a cart-load</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 58, 59, § 149</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50318.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as a measure, <hi rend="ital">a load</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vehicularis: <entryFree id="n50319" type="main" key="ve^hi^cu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕhĭcŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vehiculum</etym>, <sense id="n50319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <cb n="VEII" /> <hi rend="ital">belonging to carriages</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vehicles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <trans><tr>the post</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18:section=4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 4, 18, § 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vehicularius: <entryFree id="n50320" type="main" key="ve^hi^cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕhĭcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vehiculum</etym>, <sense id="n50320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to carriages</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vehicles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carriage-</hi>: fabricator, <hi rend="ital">a carriage-maker</hi>, Capitol. Max. et Balb. 5: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <trans><tr>the post</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Anton. 12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anton. 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also res,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vehiculum: <entryFree id="n50321" type="main" key="ve^hi^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕhĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>veho</etym>, <sense id="n50321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of transport</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a carriage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveyance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vehicle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50321.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50321.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterae animantes quae vel sedendi vehiculum praebent, vel, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 20, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi aequum est dari vehicula, qui vehar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 28</bibl></cit>: junctum vehiculum, i e. <hi rend="ital">drawn by a span</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:65:3" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 65, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:114:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 114, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:20:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 20, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50321.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A wagon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:72:section=186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 72, § 186</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50321.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A ship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">furtorum vehiculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 5, 23, § 59</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n50321.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an agricultural implement for cutting down grain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a reaping-machine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veho: <entryFree id="n50322" type="main" key="ve^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕho</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. vahāmi, conduct; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)/xos</foreign>, carriage; <foreign lang="greek">o)/xlos</foreign>, crowd; Germ. Wagen; Engl. wagon; cf. Lat. via, vexo</etym>. <sense id="n50322.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convey</hi>, on the shoulders, by wagon, by horse, by ship, etc. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">fero, gero, porto): quicquid inponas, vehunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille'st oneratus recte et plus justo vehit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siquidem'st decorum erum vehere servom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reticulum panis onusto umero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formica ore cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille taurus, qui vexit Europam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:28:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 28, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem plaustro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:52" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tantalides ... Pisaeam Phrygiis equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:386" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum triumphantem (Camillum) albi per urbem vexerant equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 28, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">te, Bacche pater, tuae Vexere tigres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Troica qui profugis sacra vehis ratibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:40" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum caelum stellas, dum vehet amnis aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodque suo Tagus amne vehit aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod fugiens semel hora vexit,</quote> <trans><tr>has brought along</tr>, <tr>has brought</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 48</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">navim prospexi, quanti veheret interrogavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 41</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be carried</hi> or <hi rend="ital">borne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi aequom'st dari ... vehicla qui vehar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visus est in somnis curru quadrigarum vehi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:70:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 70, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehi in essedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 24, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectus curru,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:82:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 82, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 360</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehi per urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in navibus vehi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:37:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 37, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in navi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lintribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=156" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 156</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">puppe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvā rate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 319</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">huc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem, ubi vectus fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:68:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 68, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in niveis victor equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:724" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 724</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nympha vehitur pisce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—Of other swift motions: <cit><quote lang="la">ut animal sex motibus veheretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes liquidum trans aethera vectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 65</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventis maria omnia vecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 524</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50322.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be borne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ride</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sail</hi>, etc., upon any thing (rare, and perh. only in the <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi> and in the gerund): consuli proconsul obviam in equo vehens venit, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:2:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per medias laudes quasi quadrigis vehens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:331" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 97, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partim scripserunt, qui ovarent, introire solitos equo vehentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:6:27" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 6, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 7, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui lectica per urbem vehendi jus tribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
veii: <entryFree id="n50323" type="main" key="Ve_ii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vēii</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vēji</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient city in Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the twelve towns of the Etrurian confederacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conquered by Camillus</hi>, near the mod. village of <hi rend="ital">Isola</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 7</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 44, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 39</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n50323.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vēiens</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vējens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Veii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Veientian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 17, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arvum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 44, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 52</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vēiens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Veii</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 44, 100</bibl>.—Mostly <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veientes,</quote> <trans><tr>the inhabitants of Veii</tr>, <tr>the Veientes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 44, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:2:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 2, 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n50323.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vēientānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Vējen -</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Veii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Veientian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 30</bibl>: uva, mart. 2, 53, 4.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vēientāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. <pb n="1963" /> <cb n="VEL" /> gemma): <cit><quote lang="la">Italica,</quote> <trans><tr>a black precious stone found near Veii</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 69, § 184</bibl></cit>.— <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vējentānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. vinum), <hi rend="ital">an inferior sort of wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 143</bibl>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:147" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:104:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 104, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:49:1" default="NO">3, 49, 1</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Vējentāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Veii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Veientians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50323.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vejus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vēï^us</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Veii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Veian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux Veïus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Tolumnius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 10, 31.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vēia</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vēja</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a proper name of a woman</hi>, Hor Epod. 5, 29.</sense></entryFree>
vejento: <entryFree id="n50324" type="main" key="Ve_jento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vējento</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the Fabrician</hi> gens.; esp., </sense><sense id="n50324.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A contemporary of Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a judge in Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 3, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50324.2" n="2" level="3"> A. Fabricius Vejento, <hi rend="ital">a courtier under Nero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 50</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:185" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 185</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:113 al" default="NO">4, 113 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
vejovis: <entryFree id="n50325" type="main" key="Ve_jo^vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vējŏvis</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Vēdiŏvis</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vēdiiŏvis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. ve and Jov-; cf. Juppiter; prop. anti-Jove</etym>, <sense id="n50325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Etruscan divinity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a god of the under world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose power to injure corresponded to the power of Jupiter to help; worshipped at Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where his temple stood in the hollow between the Arx and the Capitol; he was sometimes identified with Apollo;</hi> v. Preller, Röm. Myth. p. 235; <cit><quote lang="la">form Vejovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:24:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 24, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, § 167</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 9</bibl>.—Form Vediovis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:430" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 430</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:10:section=74" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 10, § 74</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1287</bibl>; cf. Kal. Praenest., Mens. Jan. 1 and Mens. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7</bibl> ap. Orell. Inscr. 2, pp. 382, 386.—Form Vediiovis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:12:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 12, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50325.1" n="II" level="1"> With a fanciful comment on the etymology, identified with the infant Jupiter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:447" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 447</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=379" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 379</bibl> Müll.; cf. also Vedius.</sense></entryFree>
vel: <entryFree id="n50326" type="main" key="ve^l"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕl</orth>, <sense id="n50326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>old <hi rend="ital">imv.</hi> of volo</etym> prop., <hi rend="ital">will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take your choice;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n50326.1" n="I" level="1"> As disjunctive conjunction, to introduce an alternative as a matter of choice or preference, or as not affecting the principal assertion (while aut introduces an absolute or essential opposition; cf. Madv. Gr. § 436; Zumpt, Gr. § 339; Fischer, Gr. § 383). </sense><sense id="n50326.2" n="A" level="2"> Singly. </sense><sense id="n50326.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">or</hi> (if you will), <hi rend="ital">or else</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or</hi> (at your pleasure), <hi rend="ital">or</hi> (at least), <hi rend="ital">or</hi> (it is indifferent), <hi rend="ital">or</hi> (what is the same thing), etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">dic igitur me passerculum ... haedillum me tuom dic esse vel vitellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 77</bibl></cit>: viginti minis? <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Utrum vis, vel quater quinis minis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lege vel tabellas redde,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in solem ponito vel sine sale in defrutum condito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 7</bibl></cit>: orabant (sc. Ubii), ut sibi auxilium ferret ... vel ... exercitum modo Rhenum transportaret, <hi rend="ital">or at least</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">or</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if he preferred it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusmodi conjunctionem tectorum oppidum vel urbem appellaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 26, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in unius voluntate vel moribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in unā urbe vel in hac ipsā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constituere vel conservare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 38, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ardore caelesti, qui aether vel caelum nominatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transfer idem ad modestiam vel temperantiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 60</bibl></cit>; cf. Madv. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 25, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum illud extimescebam, ne quid turpiter facerem, vel dicam, jam effecissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: haec neque confirmare argumentis neque refellere in animo est; <cit><quote lang="la">ex ingenio suo quisque demat vel addat fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n50326.5" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">potius</hi>, to correct or make more precise what has been said, <hi rend="ital">or rather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hoc populo indomito vel potius immani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 44, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post obitum vel potius excessum Romuli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 30, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cessit auctoritati amplissimi viri vel potius paruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide quid licentiae nobis tua liberalitas det, vel potius audaciae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludorum plausus vel testimonia potius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam valde ille reditu vel potius reversione meā laetatus!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novem tibi orbibus, vel potius globis conexa sunt omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimas vel potius omnes ex se ipso virtutes contulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:109" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 109</bibl></cit>.—In climax after a negative: <cit><quote lang="la">tu certe numquam in hoc ordine vel potius numquam in hac urbe mansisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 15, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.6" n="b" level="4"> So corrective, without potius: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec tu melius vel optime omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clariore vel plane perspicua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 12, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capua ab duce eorum Capye, vel. quod propius vero est, a campestri agro appellata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum P. Decius se in Samnium vel in Etruriam proficisci paratum esse ostendisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 26, 4</bibl></cit>.—Esp. <cb n="VEL" /> in the phrase vel dicam, <hi rend="ital">or let me rather say</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or rather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando enim nobis, vel dicam aut oratoribus bonis aut poëtis, ullus ... ornatus defuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:57:207" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 57, 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 31, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 13</bibl>.—So intensive, <hi rend="ital">or I may even say</hi> (cf. II. A. 3. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes binos consules, vel dicam amplius, omnia nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8, p. 106" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, p. 106</bibl></cit> Bip.: <cit><quote lang="la">a plerisque vel dicam ab omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:70:246" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 70, 246</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.7" n="c" level="4"> Vel etiam, <hi rend="ital">or even</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut expositio quarundam rerum gestarum vel etiam fabulosarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 12</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50326.8" n="d" level="4"> = aut, <hi rend="ital">or else.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50326.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With an alternative necessary consequence: <cit><quote lang="la">id autem nec nasci potest nec mori, vel concidat omne caelum omnisque natura consistat necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:23:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 23, 54</bibl></cit> Tischer ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vel tu ne faceres tale in adulescentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.10" n="(b)" level="5"> In gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si copias armatorum ... secum expenderent, vincendum illā acie vel cadendum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem omnibus ex naturā aequalem oblivione apud posteros vel gloriă distingui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod imperium variā sorte laetum rei publicae aut atrox, principibus prosperum vel exitio fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 68</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:624 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 624 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 601</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n50326.11" n="e" level="4"> In a subordinate alternative after aut: <cit><quote lang="la">nec aut tibi ipsi aut huic Secundo vel huic Apro ignotas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne contra Gai quidem aut Claudii vel Neronis ... domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abscedens in hortos aut Tusculanum vel Antiatem in agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dementiae quoque judicia aut propter id quod factum est aut propter id quod adhuc fieri vel non fieri potest instituuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.12" n="B" level="2"> As co-ordinate. </sense><sense id="n50326.13" n="1" level="3"> Vel ... vel, <hi rend="ital">either ... or</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be it ... or;</hi> in gen. (class.; but where the alternatives are necessary and exclusive, that is, where one must be right and the other wrong, aut ... aut is used; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, and cf.
