Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:11:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 11, 27</bibl>): sed hic numquis adest? <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Vel adest vel non, i. e. <hi rend="ital">just as you please</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 28</bibl> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis me misit ad eam ... vel ut ducentos Philippos reddat aureos, vel ut hinc eat secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:1:18 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 1, 18 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi illic biberit, vel servato meum modum vel ego dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel tu me vende, vel face quod tibi lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quamobrem huc sum missa, amabo, vel tu mihi ajas, vel neges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Allobrogibus sese vel persuasuros ... existimabant, vel vi coacturos, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (Romani) vel sibi agros attribuant vel patiantur eos tenere, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel sumptuosae vel desidiosae illecebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni vel officio vel sermone sollers,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximum virtutis vel documentum, vel officium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pace vel Quirini vel Romuli dixerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant quaestiones vel de caede vel de vi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:14:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 14, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:242" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 69, 242</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus vel bello vel paci paratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc ordinem ex censu descripsit vel paci decorum vel bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 42, 5</bibl></cit>: Etruriam et Samnium provincias esse; <cit><quote lang="la">utram mallet eligeret: suo exercitu se vel in Etruriā vel in Samnio rem gesturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladioque ruptis omnibus loris, oraculi sortem vel elusit vel implevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil illo fuisset excellentius vel in vitiis vel in virtutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Milt. 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.14" n="b" level="4"> Connected with <hi rend="ital">aut</hi>, but not corresponding to it (cf. infra, 2. e.): <cit><quote lang="la">num aut tuum aut cujusquam nostrum nomen vel Caucasum hunc transcendere potuit vel illum Gangem transnatare?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi enim potest illa aetas aut calescere vel apricatione melius vel igni aut vicissim umbris aquisve refrigerari salubrius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si velim scribere quid aut legere aut canere vel voce vel fidibus, aut geometricum quiddam aut physicum aut dialecticum explicare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 59, 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.15" n="2" level="3"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n50326.16" n="a" level="4"> With weakened disjunctive force (nearly = et ... et). quemadmodum ille vel Athenis vel Rhodi se doctissimorum hominum sermonibus dedisset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos sine ratione, sine litteris, quā vel inpudentia vel fames duxit, ruentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectus vel illos mites vel hos concitatos in suā potestate habuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: eadem quaestio potest eundem vel accusatorem<cb n="VEL" />  facere vel reum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 18</bibl>: et nundina vetera ex ordine instituit, vel dies vel tempora, Lampr Alex. Sev. 43: pestilentia tanta exstiterat vel Romae, vel Achaicis urbibus, ut, etc., Treb. Gall. 5.—</sense><sense id="n50326.17" n="b" level="4"> More than twice, <hi rend="ital">either ... or ... or</hi>, etc. tu vel suda, vel peri algu, vel tu aegrota, vel vale, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hance tu mihi vel vi vel clam vel precario Fac tradas: meā nil re fert, dum potiar modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel in tempestate, vel in agris, vel in corporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 44, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel quod ita vivit vel quod ita rem publicam gerit vel quod ita factus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel spectator laudum tuarum vel particeps vel socius vel minister consiliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,018:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. Quir. 9, 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so eight times,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50326.18" n="c" level="4"> The second (or last) vel strengthened, </sense><sense id="n50326.19" n="(a)" level="5"> By etiam: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vel ad usum vitae vel etiam ad ipsam rem publicam conferre possumus,</quote> <trans><tr>or even</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:8:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 8, 30</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 29, 45</bibl>; 2, 1, 1; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vel ea defendam, quae Pompejus velit, vel taceam, vel etiam ad nostra me studia referam litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.20" n="(b)" level="5"> By vero etiam: <cit><quote lang="la">in mediocribus vel studiis vel officiis, vel vero etiam negotiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.21" n="(g)" level="5"> By omnino: haec vel ad odium, vel ad misericordiam, vel omnino ad animos judicum movendos ex iis quae sunt ante posita, sumentur (<hi rend="ital">or in general</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:36:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 36, 128</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.22" n="d" level="4"> Rarely after a negative = neque, <hi rend="ital">nor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque satis Bruto ... vel tribunis militum constabat, quid agerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.23" n="e" level="4"> In irregular construction, without the second vel: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumque est in his, quod ab hoc oratore abhorreat: vel quod omnis, qui sapientes non sint, insanos esse dicunt ... accedit quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:18:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 18, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 7, 5</bibl>; cf. esp. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 383</bibl> sqq. Munro ad loc. —</sense><sense id="n50326.24" n="f" level="4"> Vel ... vel = aut ... aut: <cit><quote lang="la">habere ea, quae secundum naturam sint, vel omnia vel plurima et maxima,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>so nearly all that the difference is unimportant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:11:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Madv. ad loc.: cum bonā quidem spe, ut ait idem, vel vincendi vel in libertate moriendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.—For vel ... vel, in a subordinate alternative after aut, v. the examples under I. B. 1. b. supra.—</sense><sense id="n50326.25" n="g" level="4"> Vel, correl. with <hi rend="ital">aut</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">verborum quoque vis ac proprietas confirmatur vel praesumptione ... aut reprehensione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces ... aut productione tantum vel correptione mutatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 69</bibl></cit> (but the line <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 546</bibl>, is spurious); so, <cit><quote lang="la">aut ... aut ... vel: ut aut de nomine aut scripto et sententiā vel ratiocinatione quaeratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut ... aut ... aut ... aut ... vel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:68 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 68 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi regnat Protogenes aliquis vel Diphilus aut Erimarchus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:120" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 120</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n50326.26" n="II" level="1"> As intens. particle (prop. ellipt., implying an alternative the first member of which is omitted, something else <hi rend="ital">or even</hi> this, etc.). </sense><sense id="n50326.27" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">or even</hi>, <hi rend="ital">if you will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or indeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or ... itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">even</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assuredly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50326.28" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum opsonium autem pol vel legioni sat est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me di ament, vel in lautumiis, vel in pistrino mavelim Agere aetatem, Quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ep.</hi> Si arte poteris accubare. <hi rend="ital">Ge.</hi> Vel inter cuneos ferreos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel rex semper maxumas Mihi agebat gratias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tamen vel regnum malo quam liberum populum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:34:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 34, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">isto quidem modo vel consulatus vituperabilis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:10:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se vel principes ejus consilii fore profiterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel Priamo miseranda manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vel Prochytam praepono Suburae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile me paterer vel illo ipso acerrimo judice quaerente vel apud Cassianos judices ... pro Sex. Roscio dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus Romanus auctoritatem suam vel contra omnes defendere potest,</quote> <trans><tr>even if necessary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 22, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id se probaturum vel ipso Verginio judice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:44:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 44, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli necessitatibus eam patientiam non adhibebimus, quam vel lusus ac voluptas elicere solet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timebant ne Romana plebs ... vel cum servitute pacem acciperet,</quote> <trans><tr>even if it should involve their enslavement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.29" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">adjj.: Ch.</hi> Pax, te tribus verbis volo. <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Vel trecentis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 122</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Ut opperiare hos sex dies saltem modo ... <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Animo bono es. Vel sex mensis opperibor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 89</bibl>; cf.: jam hercle vel ducentae<pb n="1964" /> <cb n="VELA" />  minae, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 68</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 3, 111: hoc ascensu vel tres armati quamlibet multitudinem arcuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 24, 7</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Dane suavium? <hi rend="ital">Di.</hi> Immo vel decem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illum eunuchum, si opus sit, vel sobrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sit opus, vel totum triduom,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sunt omnia ingenii vel mediocris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.30" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi>: namque edepol quamvis desubito vel cadus vorti potest, <hi rend="ital">may even be turned over</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">will be empty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ego hinc abiero, vel occidito,</quote> <trans><tr>if you will</tr>, <tr>even</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per me vel stertas licet, inquit Carneades, non modo quiescas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ipsis sententiis, quibus proluserunt, vel pugnare possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vel abundare debeam, cogor mutuari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15</bibl></cit> 15, 3—</sense><sense id="n50326.31" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">pronn.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videndum erit, quid quisque vel sine nobis aut possit consequi aut non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existiment quod velint, ac vel hoc intellegant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est tibi ex his ipsis qui assunt bella copia, vel ut a te ipso ordiare,</quote> <trans><tr>especially as you can begin with yourself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:40:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 40, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.32" n="B" level="2"> With superlatives, to denote the highest possible degree, <hi rend="ital">the very; the utmost; the most...possible.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50326.33" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>: hoc invenisset unum ad morbum illum homini vel bellissimum, <hi rend="ital">the very loveliest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the most beautiful possible</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 527, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi in dolore podagrae ipsum vel omnium maximum Stoicorum Posidonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:ib. 32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fragm. ib. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc in genere nervorum vel minimum, suavitatis autem est vel plurimum,</quote> <trans><tr>the very least ... the utmost possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 26, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum duarum (civitatum) si adessent (legationes), duo crimina vel maxima minuerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patre meā sententiā vel eloquentissimo temporibus illis,</quote> <trans><tr>the most eloquent possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod erat ad obtinendam potentiam nobilium vel maximum, vehementer id retinebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:32:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 32, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (sc. Hannibalis) eo tempore vel maxima apud regem auctoritas erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vident unum senatorem vel tenuissimum esse damnatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fora templaque occupabantur, ut vel exspectatissimi triumphi laetitia praecipi posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:51" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed vel potentissima apud Amphictyonas aequi tractatio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:118" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:81" default="NO">11, 1, 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.34" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">With advv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel studiosissime quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Sophocles vel optime scripserit Electram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel maxime confirmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:65:162" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 65, 162</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vel maxime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:4" default="NO">4, 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.35" n="C" level="2"> In adding an instance implying that other instances might be mentioned at will, <hi rend="ital">or</hi> this one; <hi rend="ital">for instance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for example</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as for example</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in particular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Per pol quam paucos reperias Fideles amatores ... Vel hic Pamphilus jurabat quotiens Bacchidi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel heri in vino quam inmodestus fuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: nullast tam facilis res quin difficilis siet Quom invitus facias; <cit><quote lang="la">vel me haec deambulatio ... ad languorum dedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed suavis accipio litteras, vel quas proxime acceperam, quam prudentis!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus innumerabilia sunt exempla, vel Appii majoris illius, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 284</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.36" n="D" level="2"> Concessive. </sense><sense id="n50326.37" n="1" level="3"> With superlatives, <hi rend="ital">perhaps</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens vel potentissimus nostrae civitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. A. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus vel optima Messanae, notissima quidem certe,</quote> <trans><tr>the best known</tr>, <tr>at any rate</tr>, <tr>if not the finest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:2:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 2, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50326.38" n="2" level="3"> = saltem, <hi rend="ital">at least</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā re etsi minus veram causam habebis, tamen vel probabilem aliquam poteris inducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimi semetipsos exhortantur vel aliquas partes earum (scientiarum) addiscere, quamvis universas percipere non possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac, ni flexisset animos, vel Aegypti praefecturam concedi sibi oraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut messe vel unā releves colla perusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:12:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 12, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 8</bibl>; cf. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:16:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 16, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vela: <entryFree id="n50327" type="main" key="vela"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vela</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Gallic name for the plant</hi> erysimon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 75, § 158</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
velabrensis: <entryFree id="n50328" type="main" key="Ve_la_brensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vēlābrensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. 2. Velabrum.</entryFree>
velabrum: <entryFree id="n50329" type="main" key="ve_la_brum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlābrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>velo</etym>, <sense id="n50329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">awning</hi> stretched above the theatre, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50330" type="main" key="Ve_la_brum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vēlābrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n50330.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A street in Rome on the Aventine Hill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the</hi> <cb n="VELI" /> <hi rend="ital">Vicus Tuscus and the Forum Boarium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where especially oil-dealers and cheesemongers sold their wares</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=43 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 43 sq.</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 229</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:33" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 9, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:405" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 405</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vēlābrensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Velabrum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Velabrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:32:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 32, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:52:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 52, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50330.1" n="II" level="1"> Velabrum Minus, <hi rend="ital">a small street in Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=156" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 156</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
velamen: <entryFree id="n50331" type="main" key="ve_la_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>velo</etym>, <sense id="n50331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">robe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">garment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veil</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 649</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 221</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 566</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 147</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 579</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 267</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:178" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 178</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 11:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
velamentum: <entryFree id="n50332" type="main" key="ve_la_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covering.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50332.1" n="I" level="1"> Lit </sense><sense id="n50332.2" n="A" level="2"> Infantis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">estque id aliquanto melius velamentum cerebro quam caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 18</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n50332.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A veil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curtain</hi>, = velum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 15:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 15, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50332.4" n="C" level="2"> Velamenta, <hi rend="ital">olive-branches wound about with woollen fillets</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">rods wound about in like manner</hi>, which suppliants bore before them: <cit><quote lang="la">velamenta manu praetendens supplice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramos oleae ac velamenta alia supplicum porrigentes orare, ut reciperent sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:30:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 30, 14</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; 25, 25, 6; 30, 36, 5; 36, 20, 1; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 16, 6</bibl>. velamenta et infulas praeferentes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 66</bibl>; v. velo, I. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n50332.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">screen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerentes libidinibus suis patrocinium aliquid seu velamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 12:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ami citiae,</quote> <trans><tr>pretence</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
velaris: <entryFree id="n50333" type="main" key="ve_la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>velum</etym>, <sense id="n50333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a veil</hi> or <hi rend="ital">curtain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anuli,</quote> <trans><tr>curtainrings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 9, 18, § 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
velarium: <entryFree id="n50334" type="main" key="ve_la_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">screen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awning</hi>, stretched above the theatre to keep off the sun, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:122" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
velarius: <entryFree id="n50335" type="gloss" key="ve_la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n50335.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A slave who attended to closing the curtains at the entrance of an apartment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a door-keeper</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 599, 7 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50335.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sailor who attended to furling and unfurling the sails</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3642</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
velati: <entryFree id="n50336" type="main" key="ve_la_ti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlāti</orth>, v. velo, I. B.</entryFree>
velatio: <entryFree id="n50337" type="main" key="ve_la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>velo</etym>, <sense id="n50337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a veiling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">giving the veil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep 150" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep 150 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
velato: <entryFree id="n50338" type="main" key="ve_la_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v velo <sense id="n50338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
velauni: <entryFree id="n50339" type="main" key="Ve^launi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕlauni</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vellavii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Aquitania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Gabali and the Segusiani</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Vélay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veleda: <entryFree id="n50340" type="main" key="Ve^le^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕlĕda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prophetic virgin among the Germans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regarded as a divine being</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 22</bibl>; 5, 24; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:90" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veles: <entryFree id="n50341" type="main" key="ve_le^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>volare, velox, flying troops</etym>, <sense id="n50341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of light-armed soldier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who attacked the enemy out of the line of battle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a skirmisher.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50341.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, usually in the <number>plur.</number>: velites, Liv 26, 4, 4 sq.; 21, 55, 11; 23, 29, 3; 38, 21, 13; 30, 33, 3; Varr ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 552, 30</bibl>; Ov Ib. 48 (Merkel, militis); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 3, 3</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, Lucil. ap. Fest. s. v sub vitem, p. 308; Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 552, 26</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n50341.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">me autem a te, ut scurram velitem, malis oneratum esse, non moleste tuli,</quote> <trans><tr>as the clown of the troop</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 20, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
velia: <entryFree id="n50342" type="main" key="Ve^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n50342.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An elevated part of the Palatine Hill at Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=54" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 54</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7, 6</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕlĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Velia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Velian</hi>: Veliense sexticeps in Veliā apud aedem deum penatium, an old formula ap. Varr. L. L. l. l.—</sense><sense id="n50342.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town on the coast of Lucania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colony of the Phocœans</hi>, orig. called <foreign lang="greek">*(ue/lh</foreign>, afterwards <foreign lang="greek">*)ele/a</foreign>, Lat. Elea (v. h. v.), now <hi rend="ital">Castellamare della Bruca</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:16:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:40:section=99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 40, § 99</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 17, § 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 1 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n50342.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕ-lĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Velia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Velian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:24:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 24, 55</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕlĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Velia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Velians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50342.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Velia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Velian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Velia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 366</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50342.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Spanish tribe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
velifer: <entryFree id="n50343" type="main" key="ve_li^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>velum-fero</etym>, <sense id="n50343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sail-bearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9</bibl></cit> (4, 8), 35; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 719</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 495</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:126" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 129" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 129</bibl></cit>. <cb n="VELI" /></sense></entryFree>
velificatio: <entryFree id="n50344" type="main" key="ve_li^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>velifico</etym>, <sense id="n50344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making sail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sailing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50344.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutatā velificatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50344.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">velificatione plenā in rempublicam ferebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velificatione tranquillā, ut aiunt, ferebatur ad gloriam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 29, 2, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
velificium: <entryFree id="n50345" type="hapax" key="ve_li^fi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlĭfĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making sail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sailing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velificia primum invenit Isis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 277" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 277</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
velifico: <entryFree id="n50346" type="main" key="ve_li^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> (<sense id="n50346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form of velificor), <hi rend="ital">to sail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make sail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nauta per urbanas velificabat aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 6: <cit><quote lang="la">per summa aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:88" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 29, 47, § 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erectis capitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 13, 13, § 35</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velificatus Athōs,</quote> <trans><tr>sailed through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:174" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 174</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
velificor: <entryFree id="n50347" type="main" key="ve_li^fi^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlĭfĭcor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype> (<sense id="n50347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> parag. velificarier, Afr. Com. 267), 1, <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [velum-facio], <hi rend="ital">to make sail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread sail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sail.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50347.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): (ratis) Caerula ad infernos velificata lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 28</bibl></cit> (3, 25), 40: <cit><quote lang="la">velificantes triumphantium in modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:7:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50347.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, with <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to make sail for</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to exert one's self to effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procure</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">gain</hi> a thing (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">honori suo velificari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: ne aut velificatus alicui dicaris, aut, etc., Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">favori civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:9:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
velificus: <entryFree id="n50348" type="hapax" key="ve_li^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>velificor</etym>, <sense id="n50348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made with sails</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sailing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursu navigii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 11, 21, § 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
veliger: <entryFree id="n50349" type="main" key="ve_li^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>velumgero</etym>, <sense id="n50349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sail-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covered with sails</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
velinus: <entryFree id="n50350" type="main" key="Ve^li_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕlīnus lăcus</orth> or simply <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕlī-nus</orth>, <sense id="n50350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lake in the Sabine territories</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Reate and Interamnum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 517</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rosea rura Velini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 712</bibl></cit>.—It gave its name to <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕlīna trĭbus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the people who dwelt around this lake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 15, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also Velina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:73" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n50351" type="main" key="Ve^li_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Velia, III. 2.</entryFree>
velitaris: <entryFree id="n50352" type="main" key="ve_li^ta_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlĭtāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>veles</etym>, <sense id="n50352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> velites: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 105:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 105, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 201</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlĭtāres</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = velites (late Lat.), Amm 19, 3, 1.</sense></entryFree>
velitatio: <entryFree id="n50353" type="main" key="ve_li^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>velitor</etym>, <sense id="n50353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a skirmishing</hi> with words, <hi rend="ital">a bickering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrangling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispute</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">velitatio dicta est ultro citroque probrorum objectatio, ab exemplo velitaris pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=369" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 369</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">velitatio dicitur levis contentio, dicta ex congressione militum (i.e. velitum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis velitationem fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit> (al. as one word, verbivelitationem; cf. Ussing ad loc.): me ad velitationem exerceo. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veliterninus: <entryFree id="n50354" type="main" key="Ve^li_terni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕlīternīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Velitrae, B.</entryFree>
veliternus: <entryFree id="n50355" type="main" key="Ve^li_ternus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕlīternus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Velitrae, A.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50356" type="main" key="Ve^li_ternus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕlīternus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:229" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 229</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
velites: <entryFree id="n50357" type="main" key="ve_li^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlĭtes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, v. veles.</entryFree>
velitor: <entryFree id="n50358" type="main" key="ve_li^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlĭtor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n50358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [veles], <hi rend="ital">to fight like the</hi> velites or <hi rend="ital">light troops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to skirmish</hi> (ante- and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n50358.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eum lapidibus crebris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 234, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus postremis calcibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, p. 195, 12.—In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">primis Veneris proeliis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 168, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50358.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc saga illa primis adhuc armis disciplinae suae velitatur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>makes the first attempt</tr>, <tr>essays</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra aliquem scurrilibus jocis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>, p. 213, 11: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniis in aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quid vos velitati estis inter vos duo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have wrangled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus impudentes et improbos in maledictis (with decertare convicio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:11:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to threaten with danger</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 164</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
velitrae: <entryFree id="n50359" type="main" key="Ve^li_trae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕlītrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Volsci</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whence came the Octavian family</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Velletri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:379" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 379</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n50359.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕlīternus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Velitrœ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:38" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 1, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 36</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕlīterni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Velitrœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50359.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕlīternī-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Velitrœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Veliternian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 65</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1965" /> <cb n="VELL" /></sense></entryFree>
velivolans: <entryFree id="n50360" type="hapax" key="ve_li^vo^lans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlĭvŏlans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>velum-volo</etym>, <sense id="n50360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sail-flying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flying with sails</hi>, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of a ship: naves, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 67</bibl>; cf. velivolus.</sense></entryFree>
velivolus: <entryFree id="n50361" type="main" key="ve_li^vo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlĭvŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sail-flying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winged with sails</hi>, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of a ship: naves, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 5</bibl> (Ann. v. 381, and Trag. v. 111 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:5:42" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 5, 42</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare velivolis florebat puppibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with ships</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1442</bibl></cit> (1440).—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, an epithet of the sea: maria alta velivola, Liv. And. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 224</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vella: <entryFree id="n50362" type="main" key="vella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. villa <sense id="n50362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
vellatura: <entryFree id="n50363" type="hapax" key="vella_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vellātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contr. from vehelatura, from veho</etym>, <sense id="n50363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveyance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellaturam facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vellaunodunum: <entryFree id="n50364" type="main" key="Vellaunodu_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vellaunodūnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n50364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of</hi> Gallia Celtica, <hi rend="ital">in the territory of the Senones</hi>, prob. the modern <hi rend="ital">Beaune</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
velleius: <entryFree id="n50365" type="main" key="Velle_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vellēius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n50365.1" n="I" level="1"> C. Velleius Paterculus, <hi rend="ital">an historian under Augustus and Tiberius;</hi> v. Bähr, Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Gesch. § 203 sq.—</sense><sense id="n50365.2" n="II" level="1"> C. Velleins, <hi rend="ital">an Epicurean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friend of Crassus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:21:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 21, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 6, 15</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n50365.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vel-lēius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Velleius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Velleian</hi>: lex, perh. <hi rend="ital">called after the consul</hi> C. Velleius Tutor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:2:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:3:3" default="NO">28, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50365.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vellēiānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of a Velleius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Velleian</hi>: senatusconsultum, <hi rend="ital">called after the consul</hi> C. Velleius Tutor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vellicatim: <entryFree id="n50366" type="hapax" key="velli^ca_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vellĭcātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>vellico</etym>, qs. <sense id="n50366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by pinches</hi> or <hi rend="ital">twitches</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">piecemeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disconnectedly</hi>: vellicatim ac saltuatim scribere, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 188, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vellicatio: <entryFree id="n50367" type="main" key="velli^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vellĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plucking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twitching;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">a twitting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taunting</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum non tantum lacerationes, sed etiam vellicationes effugerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 5:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 5, 3</bibl></cit>; id. Ira, 3, 43, 5.</sense></entryFree>
vellico: <entryFree id="n50368" type="main" key="velli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vellĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vello</etym>, <sense id="n50368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pluck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twitch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pinch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nip</hi> (syn. carpo). </sense><sense id="n50368.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornix vulturios vellicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer, quid fieret, interrogatus, a paedagogo se vellicari respondit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saetas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellicata blande auricula suscitavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 36, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50368.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of bees: <cit><quote lang="la">nullius opus,</quote> <trans><tr>to suck</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50368.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50368.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To wake up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arouse</hi> by twitching: <cit><quote lang="la">excitandus e somno et vellicandus est animus admonendusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 20:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 20, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:63:1" default="NO">63, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50368.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To pluck</hi> or <hi rend="ital">twitch</hi> in speaking, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to twit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rail at</hi> (cf. rodo): <cit><quote lang="la">contemplent, conspiciant omnes, nutent, nectent, sibilent, vellicent, vocent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">more hominum invident, in conviviis rodunt, in circulis vellicant, maledico dente carpunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:26:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 26, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod vellicet absentem Demetrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 79</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum est tam plenum beneficium, quod non vellicare malignitas possit,</quote> <trans><tr>belittle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:28:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(puella) te vellicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:5:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:15:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 15, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vello: <entryFree id="n50369" type="main" key="vello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vello</orth>, <itype>vulsi, vulsum</itype> (<sense id="n50369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> velli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:155" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 155</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 10, 6, 36, p. 897</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 1, p. 369</bibl> ib.; ante-class. form of <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> volsum; v. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 576), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>prob. akin to <foreign lang="greek">e(/l-kw</foreign></etym>. </sense><sense id="n50369.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n50369.2" n="A" level="2"> Of animals, <hi rend="ital">to pluck</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pull</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to deprive of the hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feathers</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 73, § 190</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anseres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 22, 27, § 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50369.3" n="B" level="2"> Of things. </sense><sense id="n50369.4" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to pluck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pull</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">tear out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">up;</hi> in simple constr.: <cit><quote lang="la">plumas anserum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:13:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caudae pilos equinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot spicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:889" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 889</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:37:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 37, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuneum vellito, statimque surculos in ea foramina immittito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 11, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 26:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 26, 4</bibl>: signa, <hi rend="ital">to take up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">march</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 19</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vellerent signa et Romam proficiscerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors viscera vulsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 546</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes a cardine vellit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">albos a stirpe capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 25, 13: <cit><quote lang="la">asparagum ab radice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 42, § 149</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">aut castris audebit vellere signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genae florem primaevo corpore vulsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 562</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfixam oculo sagittam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulsis pectore telis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 232</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">unguibus et raras vellentem dentibus herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:800" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8,800</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastam ... de cespite vellit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 566</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbas de caespite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 414</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50369.5" n="2" level="3"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n50369.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To pluck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pull</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">tear down</hi> or <cb n="VELO" /> <hi rend="ital">away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pars vellerent vallum, atque in fossas proruerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 14, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">munimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 25, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50369.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To pluck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pick</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">gather</hi> fruit, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">modo nata malā vellere poma manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:5:20" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 5, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50369.8" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To pull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twitch</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">aurem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cop. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:155" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 155</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellere coepi Et prensare manu lentissima bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus digitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 606</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50369.9" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To be plucked</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pulled</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to have the hair pulled out by the roots</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa corporis curam morosior, ut non solum tonderetur diligenter ac raderetur, sed velleretur etiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50369.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to tear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed mea secreto velluntur pectora morsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:3" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vulsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">volsus</orth>), <itype>a</itype>, um. </sense><sense id="n50369.11" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">shorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plucked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smooth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beardless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hairless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istum gallum Glabriorem reddes mihi quam volsus ludiust,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulsi levatique et inustas comas acu comentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus vulsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem (corpora) si quis vulsa atque fucata muliebriter comat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. 19: <cit><quote lang="la">nepos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 23.—</sense><sense id="n50369.12" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">effeminate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:36:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 36, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50369.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Suffering convulsions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spasmodic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 19, 74, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:25" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 16, § 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vellus: <entryFree id="n50370" type="main" key="vellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vellus</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. ura for vara, sheep; root var, to cover; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/r-ion, ei)=ros</foreign>, wool; Goth. vulla; Germ. Wolle</etym>. <sense id="n50370.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">wool shorn off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fleece</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastores Palatini ex ovibus ante tonsuram inventam vellere lanam sunt soliti: a quo vellera dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5</bibl></cit>, §§ 54 and 130 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 7, 28, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 504</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:21" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 264</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50370.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50370.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The skin of a sheep with the wool on it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fell</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pelt</hi> entire, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:62" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 102</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n50370.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pelt</hi> of any other animal: <cit><quote lang="la">fulvi leonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:340" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 340</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:396" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 396</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 593</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:197" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 197</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50370.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sheep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultrosque in guttura velleris atri Conicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 244</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 2, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50370.5" n="B" level="2"> Of woolly material. </sense><sense id="n50370.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Wool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">down</hi>: velleraque ut foliis depectant tenuia Seres, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the fleeces</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flocks of silk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 121</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50370.7" n="2" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleecy clouds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuia nec lanae per caelum vellera ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 397</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 124</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50370.8" n="3" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">snow-flakes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:3:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 3, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n50370.9" n="C" level="2"> Of things made of wool: Parnasia, <hi rend="ital">woollen bands</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fillets</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:8" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
velo: <entryFree id="n50371" type="main" key="ve_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>velum</etym>, <sense id="n50371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrap up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envelop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veil</hi>, etc. (class.; syn.: contego, induo). </sense><sense id="n50371.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">capite velato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:48" default="NO">6, 1, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput velatum filo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 6</bibl></cit>;
