cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">capita ante aras Phrygio amictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 545</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:143" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes tegendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velanda corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 24, 3</bibl></cit>: antennas, <hi rend="ital">covered with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">supporting the sails</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 549</bibl>.—Of clothing: <cit><quote lang="la">velatus togā,</quote> <trans><tr>enveloped</tr>, <tr>clothed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpurea veste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:645" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 645</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stolā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:25" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 25</bibl> (3, 4, 55): <cit><quote lang="la">amiculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeros chlamyde,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 19</bibl></cit>.—Of other objects: <cit><quote lang="la">maternā tempora myrto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora purpureis tiaris,</quote> <trans><tr>to wrap round</tr>, <tr>bind round</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora vittis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:14:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in a Greek construction: Amphicus albenti velatus tempora vittā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua lauro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:592" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 592</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondibus hastam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:667" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 667</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serta molas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:312" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palatia sertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delubra deūm fronde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 249</bibl></cit>: velatis manibus orant, ignoscamus peccatum suum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">holding the</hi> velamenta (v. h. v. I. C.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 101</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">velati ramis oleae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 101</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50371.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>; <pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">soldiers who wore only a cloak;</hi> only in the phrase accensi velati, <hi rend="ital">a kind of supernumerary troops who followed the army to fill the places of any who might fall</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22, 40</bibl>; and in late Lat. inscrr. freq. <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ACCENSVS VELATVS, one such soldier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1368</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2153</bibl>; 2182; v. <itype>accenseo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> B.—</sense><sense id="n50371.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi> (post-Aug.; several times in Tac.; <cit><quote lang="la">otherwise rare): odium fallacibus blanditiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">externa falsis armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primas adulescentis cupidines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam invidiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 29</bibl></cit>: scelere velandum<cb n="VELU" />  est scelus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 721" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 721</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil (with omittere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:56:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 56, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">through a veil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">darkly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscurely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum discere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
velocasses: <entryFree id="n50372" type="main" key="Velocasses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Velocasses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, v. Bellocassi.</entryFree>
velocitas: <entryFree id="n50373" type="main" key="ve_lo_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlōcĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>velox</etym>, <sense id="n50373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">swiftness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleetness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapidity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">velocity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50373.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">velocitate ad cursum valere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pernicitatem et velocitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:15:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 15, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velocitas corporis celeritas appellatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 13, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:36" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:8:48" default="NO">8, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:9" default="NO">2, 20, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa in rebus moliendis velocitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:7:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:8:2" default="NO">5, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">velocitate opus est, quā celeritatem famae antecedas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">non viribus aut velocitatibus aut celeritate corporum res magnae geruntur, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50373.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (so perh. only post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">velocitas cogitationum animique celeritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi exercitata studio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:123" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagacitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—Of speech, style, <hi rend="ital">rapidity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immortalis illa Sallustii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:102" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:83" default="NO">9, 4, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:8" default="NO">10, 7, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
velociter: <entryFree id="n50374" type="main" key="ve_lo_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlōcĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. velox <sense id="n50374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
velox: <entryFree id="n50375" type="main" key="ve_lox"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlox</orth>, <itype>ōcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>akin to volare; cf. veles</etym>, <sense id="n50375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">swift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedy</hi> (class.; syn.: celer, pernix, praepes). </sense><sense id="n50375.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedites velocissimi ac fortissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velocissimus quisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Breuni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pristis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 688</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <trans><tr>rapidly growing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 13, 20, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toxicum,</quote> <trans><tr>quickly working</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:61" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 61</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">genus herbae ad mortem, etiam opio velocius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:8:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 24, 35, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Victoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia (thermae),</quote> <trans><tr>quickly built</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, for the <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille velox ... Desilit in latices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 352</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:829" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 829</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec jam hic absistere velox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:797" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 797</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piger ad poenas princeps, ad praemia velox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:123" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50375.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est animo velocius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio veloci ac mobili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura humani ingenii agilis ac velox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velox ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acutior atque velocior in urbanitate brevitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">decurrere materiam stilo quam velocissimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velocior (in conjectando),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlōcĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">swiftly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 509</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 586</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:28" default="NO">2, 4, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:81" default="NO">8, 3, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 90, § 241</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:26:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 26, 29</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
velum: <entryFree id="n50376" type="main" key="ve_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root var, to cover; cf. vellus, and v. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 459</etym>, <sense id="n50376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cloth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">awning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernacula carbaseis intenta velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12:section=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velis amictos non togis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem (i. e. uxor) si quando recito, in proximo, discreta velo, sedet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 19, 3</bibl></cit>.—So of <hi rend="ital">chamber-curtains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hangings</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:228" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 228</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:105" default="NO">9, 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adlevare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 80:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 80, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">awnings</hi> stretched over the theatre or other public places as a protection from the sun, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 103</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2219</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 6, § 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis simulationum involucris tegitur et quasi velis quibusdam obtenditur unius cujusque natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:5:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50376.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a sail</hi> (in good prose usually in <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n50376.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scindere vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad id, unde aliquis flatus ostenditur, vela do,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 23, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:45:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 45, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 281</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34:section=88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pandere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 574</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 663</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dirigere ad castra Corneliana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo utinam velis passis pervehi liceat!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12</bibl>, praef. § 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 10, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subducere, Auct. B. Alex. 45, 3: legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tendunt vela Noti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventis inplere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1966" /> <cb n="VELU" /> 23: <cit><quote lang="la">classem velis aptare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 472</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of wings: <cit><quote lang="la">pennarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:744" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 744</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50376.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navale velum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pontum vento secundo, velo passo pervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 103</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 400</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleno concita velo puppis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 491</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 483 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50376.4" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: remis velisque, <hi rend="ital">with oars and sails</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with tooth and nail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with might and main</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res velis, ut ita dicam, remisque fugienda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:11:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 11, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">remigio veloque quantum potis es festina et fuge,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit> (cf. the similar phrase, remis ventisque, sub remus); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non agimur tumidis velis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plenissimis velis navigare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 10, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50376.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum panderem vela orationis statim, an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:5:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare vela Famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:70:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 70, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voti contrahe vela tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:72" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velis majoribus,</quote> <trans><tr>with more zeal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 725</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo tu ingenii simul dolorisque velis latissime vectus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedimus vela indignationi, dedimus irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 6:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 33, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pande vela, ac, si quando alias, toto ingenio vehere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 8:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
velumen: <entryFree id="n50377" type="hapax" key="ve_lu_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēlūmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vello</etym>, <sense id="n50377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fleece</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanam demptam ac conglobatam alii vellera, alii velumina appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 9</bibl></cit> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
velut: <entryFree id="n50378" type="main" key="ve^lut"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕl-ut</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕl-ŭti</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (cf. vel, II.), <sense id="n50378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">even as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like as.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50378.1" n="I" level="1"> Correl., with a foll. <hi rend="ital">sic</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ita</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n50378.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">velut in cantu et fidibus, sic ex corporis totius naturā et figurā varios motus ciere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 20</bibl></cit> (al. vel ut): <cit><quote lang="la">cum velut Sagunti excidium Hannibali, sic, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 18, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut per fistulam, ita per apertam vitis medullam umor trahitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 18, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50378.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., to introduce comparisons: veluti Consul, cum, etc. ... sic exspectabat populus, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl> (Ann. v. 87 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ac veluti magno in populo cum saepe coorta est Seditio ... Sic, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1</bibl></cit> 148; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, II. B. 2., and atque, II. 4.—</sense><sense id="n50378.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> </sense><sense id="n50378.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">studeo hunc lenonem perdere, velut meum erum macerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum repente instructas velut in acie certo gradulegiones accedere Galli viderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:9" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne vitam silentio transeant veluti pecora, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veluti qui sentibus anguem Pressit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 379</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum velut inter pugnae fugaeque consilium trepidante equitatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 14, 8</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 31, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 29, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53:5" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 53, 5</bibl>; 2, 12, 13.—</sense><sense id="n50378.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50378.7" n="1" level="3"> To connect, by way of example, a single instance with an established general proposition, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for instance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for example</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc est incepta efficere pulchre, veluti mihi Evenit, ut ovans praedā onustus incederem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 145</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam tam male est Siculis, quin aliquid facete et commode dicant: veluti in hac re aiebant, In labores Herculis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:44:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 44, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illi dubia quaedam res ... probetur: velut apud Socraticum Aeschinem demonstrat Socrates, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:31:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 31, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est etiam admiratio nonnulla in bestiis aquatilibus iis, quae gignuntur in terrā. Veluti crocodili, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 116</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multa conjecta sunt aliud alio tempore, velut hoc, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:7:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 7, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut in hac quaestione plerique dixerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut iste chorus virtutum in eculeum inpositus imagines constituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliae quoque artes minores habent multiplicem materiam, velut architectonice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonibus ejus fruebar, veluti fuit illa sermocinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:8:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50378.8" n="2" level="3"> To introduce a comparison or figurative expression, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as it were</hi>: concurrunt veluti venti, cum spiritus Austri, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 423 Vahl.); 6, 3 (<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> v. 431</bibl> ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">frena dabat Sipylus, veluti cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">migrantes cernas totāque ex urbe ruentes, Ac, veluti ingentem formicae farris acervum Cum populant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 402</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">supra, I. B.: hic velut hereditate relictum odium paternum conservavit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoddam simplex orationis condimentum, quod sentitur latente judicio velut palato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducetur rerum ipsā serie velut duce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: haec velut sagina dicendi,<cb n="VENA" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inaequalia tantum et velut confragosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec est velut imperatoria virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 10, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50378.9" n="3" level="3"> To introduce a hypothetical comparative clause, <hi rend="ital">just as if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as though</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as though.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50378.10" n="a" level="4"> Usually velut si: <cit><quote lang="la">absentis Ariovisti crudelitatem, velut si coram adesset, horrerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus patres metus de summā rerum cepit, velut si jam ad portas hostis esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 16, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut si urbem adgressurus Scipio foret, ita, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 28, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies inducitur illis (corporibus mixtis) Una, velut si quis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 375</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50378.11" n="b" level="4"> Sometimes, in this sense, velut alone: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe, velut gemmas ejus signumque probarem, Per causam memini me tetigisse manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:25" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 25</bibl></cit> (21); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:596" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 596</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut ea res nihil ad religionem pertinuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut abundarent omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 41, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me quoque juvat, velut ipse in parte laboris ac periculi fuerim, ad finem pervenisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 1, 1</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
vemens: <entryFree id="n50379" type="main" key="ve_mens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēmens</orth>, v. vehemens.</entryFree>
vena: <entryFree id="n50380" type="main" key="ve_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. root veh-, to carry, etc.; prop. a pipe, channel; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)xeto/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n50380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blood-vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vein.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50380.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50380.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">venae et arteriae a corde tractae et profectae in corpus omne ducuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venam incidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:34:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 34, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchiorum venas interscindere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abrumpere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abscindere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsolvere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">16, 19: pertundere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:46" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secare, Suet. Vit. Luc.: ferire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:14:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50380.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an artery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cui venae sic moventur, is habet febrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:8:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 8, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentare,</quote> <trans><tr>to feel the pulse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, tangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:107" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 22</bibl>: si protinus venae conciderunt, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the pulse has sunk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fallen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">venis fugientibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:69" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 69</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50380.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things that resemble veins. </sense><sense id="n50380.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A water-course</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:43" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 43</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Alex. 8, 1: fecundae vena aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:30:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 30, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50380.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A vein of metals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:31" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50380.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The urinary passage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50380.8" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A vein</hi> or <hi rend="ital">streak</hi> of wood, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 38, 73, § 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:97" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 15, 30, § 97</bibl>. —Of stone, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 6, 24, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:36" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50380.9" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A row</hi> of trees in a garden, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 15, § 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50380.10" n="6" level="3"> = membrum virile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:66:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 66, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:49:2" default="NO">6, 49, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:16:5" default="NO">11, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:72" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 72</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50380.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50380.12" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The strength</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino fulcire venas cadentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 3, 9, 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 153</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50380.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The interior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the innate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">natural quality</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nature</hi> of a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum residebit et erit inclusum penitus in venis et visceribus rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(orator) teneat oportet venas cujusque generis, aetatis, ordinis,</quote> <trans><tr>the innermost feelings</tr>, <tr>the spring</tr>, <tr>pulse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:52:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 52, 223</bibl></cit>: si ulla vena paternae disciplinae in nobis viveret, Sev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Pesc. 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50380.14" n="C" level="2"> For a person's <hi rend="ital">natural bent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">genius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vein</hi> (the fig. taken from veins of metal): <cit><quote lang="la">ego nec studium sine divite venā, Nec rude quid possit video ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis et angusta ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benigna ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publica (vatis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:53" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venabulum: <entryFree id="n50381" type="main" key="ve_na_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnābŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>venor</etym>, <sense id="n50381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a huntingspear.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50381.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 419</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 404</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 205</bibl>; 10, 713; 12, 453; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:31:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 31, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50381.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: sagittarum, <hi rend="ital">large spear-like arrows</hi>, for killing elephants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 8, 8, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venafrum: <entryFree id="n50382" type="main" key="Ve^na_frum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnāfrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n50382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient town of the Samnites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for its olive-oil</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Venafro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 135</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 13</bibl>, b, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:101:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 101, 1</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n50382.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnāfer</orth>, <itype>fra, frum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Venafrum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50382.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnāfrānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Venafrum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Venafran</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 2, 3, § 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnāfrānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. oleum), <hi rend="ital">Venafran-oil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse Venafrano piscem perfundit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:86" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venaliciarius: <entryFree id="n50383" type="main" key="ve_na_li_ci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnālīcĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>venalicius</etym>, <sense id="n50383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to slave-selling.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50383.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>slave-dealing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:73:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 73, § 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50383.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnālīcĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a slave-dealer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:44" default="NO">21, 1, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:207 al" default="NO">50, 16, 207 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
venalicius: <entryFree id="n50384" type="main" key="ve_na_li_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnālīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>venalis</etym>, <sense id="n50384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to selling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for sale.</hi> <cb n="VENA" /> </sense><sense id="n50384.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n50384.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 76</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50384.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnālīcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">taxes on sales</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 19, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50384.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to slave-selling.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50384.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>young slaves exposed for sale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 42</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">greges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 18, 58, § 201</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50384.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50384.7" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnālīcĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a slave-dealer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:70:232" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 70, 232</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 26, 97, § 170</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50384.8" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnā-līcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n50384.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Slave-selling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:65" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3023</bibl> and 4777.— </sense><sense id="n50384.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, concr., <hi rend="ital">young slaves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:8:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 8, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venalis: <entryFree id="n50385" type="main" key="ve_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. venus</etym>, <sense id="n50385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to selling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be sold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for sale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purchasable.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50385.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50385.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedis venalis hasce inscribit litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venales ac proscriptae possessiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus uno asse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne opera quidem pistoria proponi venalia sinerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">essedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibumque coctum venalem proponi vetuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of a public crier</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium non gemmis venale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postremo dixisse (Jugurtham), Urbem venalem et mature perituram, si emptorem invenerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi non sit, quo deferri possit venale, non expediat colere (hortos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:16:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a gang of slaves for sale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50385.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a young slave offered for sale</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:51 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 51 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:56:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 56, § 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:13:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 80:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 80, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 17, 57, § 199</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 8</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caesărī vēnāles</orth> (or as one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Caesărĭvēnāles</orth>), <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a name given to the inhabitants of Castulo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Spain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50385.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that can be bought</hi> by bribes or presents, <hi rend="ital">venal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ipse semper habuit venalia, fidem, jus jurandum, veritatem, officium, religionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:62:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 62, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem cum proposuisses venalem in provinciā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">78: juris dictio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 48</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">119: multitudo pretio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 50, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicae ad munus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit> (3, 8), 21: <cit><quote lang="la">cena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:60:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 60, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:500" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 500</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venalitas: <entryFree id="n50386" type="main" key="ve_na_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>venalis, II.</etym>, <sense id="n50386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the capability of being bought</hi> (with bribes, etc.), <hi rend="ital">venality</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 13 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
venalitius: <entryFree id="n50387" type="main" key="ve_na_li_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnālītĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. venalicius.</entryFree>
venami: <entryFree id="n50388" type="main" key="Venami"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Venami</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Gaul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venaria: <entryFree id="n50389" type="main" key="Venaria"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Venaria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Tuscan Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venaticius: <entryFree id="n50390" type="main" key="ve_na_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnātīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>venaticus</etym>, <sense id="n50390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to hunting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the chase</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">praeda,</quote> <trans><tr>game</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">30, 1, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venaticus: <entryFree id="n50391" type="main" key="ve_na_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>venatus</etym>, <sense id="n50391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to hunting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hunting-.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50391.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <trans><tr>a hunting-dog</tr>, <tr>hound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:13:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 13, § 31</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">genus canum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 65</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n50391.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: prolatis rebus parasiti venatici sumus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">lean</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gaunt like hounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venatilis: <entryFree id="n50392" type="main" key="ve_na_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vena</etym>, <sense id="n50392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">springing from a vein</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venatio: <entryFree id="n50393" type="main" key="ve_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>venor</etym>, <sense id="n50393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hunting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the chase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venery.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50393.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50393.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">conditiora facit haec supervacanei operis aucupium atque venatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Suevi) multum sunt in venationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50393.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a hunting spectacle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">battue;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">a combat of wild beasts</hi>, exhibited to the people: <cit><quote lang="la">ludorum venationumque apparatu pecunias profundunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 16, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2556</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2559</bibl>; v. Smith, Antiq.—</sense><sense id="n50393.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that which is</hi> or <hi rend="ital">has been hunted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">game</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum miraremur, unde illi eo tempore anni tam multa et varia venatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:49:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 49, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capta venatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequens ibi et varia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 2, 24</bibl>; 5, 2, 26; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9</bibl>, praef. 1: septum venationis, <hi rend="ital">a preserve</hi> or <hi rend="ital">corer for game</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hunting-park</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:12:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 12, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venatitius: <entryFree id="n50394" type="main" key="ve_na_ti_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnātītĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. venaticius.</entryFree>
venator: <entryFree id="n50395" type="main" key="ve_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>venor</etym>, <sense id="n50395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hunter.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50395.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50395.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: quasi venator tu quidem<pb n="1967" /> <cb n="VEND" />  es, dies atque noctes cum cane aetatem exigis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 37, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">COLLEGIVM VENATORVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 531, 2</bibl></cit>.—In apposit.: <cit><quote lang="la">venator canis,</quote> <trans><tr>a hunting-dog</tr>, <tr>hound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:751" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 751</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <trans><tr>a hunting-horse</tr>, <tr>hunter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:685" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 685</bibl></cit>; cf. venatrix.—</sense><sense id="n50395.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (cf. venatio, I. B.), <hi rend="ital">one who fights with wild beasts</hi> in the arena, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:8:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 8, § 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Mart. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50395.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">venator adest nostris consiliis cum auritis plagis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">physicus, id est speculator venatorque naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:30:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 30, 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venatorius: <entryFree id="n50396" type="main" key="ve_na_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>venator</etym>, <sense id="n50396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a hunter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to the chase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hunter's</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hunting-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">galea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venatrix: <entryFree id="n50397" type="main" key="ve_na_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a huntress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 319</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 178</bibl> Heyne.—As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">venatrix dea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Diana</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 454</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:492" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 492</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:69:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 69, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">venatrix sane optima, non ferarum, sed libidinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Virg. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venatura: <entryFree id="n50398" type="hapax" key="ve_na_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>venor</etym>, <sense id="n50398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hunting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the chase;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">viden' tu illam oculis venaturam facere atque aucupium auribus?</quote> <trans><tr>how she hunts about with her eyes? is on the watch?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venatus: <entryFree id="n50399" type="main" key="ve_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n50399.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hunting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the chase</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor in venatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:747" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 747</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 605</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 163</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 302</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 307</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 309</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n50399.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50399.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fishing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere in venatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50399.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Game</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venatus aggerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 21, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesci venatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vendax: <entryFree id="n50400" type="hapax" key="vendax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vendax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vendo</etym>, <sense id="n50400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fond of selling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem familias vendacem, non emacem esse oportet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
vendibilis: <entryFree id="n50401" type="main" key="vendi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vendĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be sold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vendible.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50401.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">via vendibilis Herculanea multarum deliciarum et magnae pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 14, 36</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 11, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:4:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 212, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50401.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">acceptable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">popular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam ut sint illa vendibiliora, haec uberiora certe sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vendibilis orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:47:174" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 47, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(C. Visellius Varro) populo non erat satis vendibilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 76, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 25, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 12, 10</bibl></cit>. —* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vendĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">salably; pleasantly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 130, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vendico: <entryFree id="n50402" type="main" key="vendi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vendĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. vindico <sense id="n50402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
venditarius: <entryFree id="n50403" type="spur" key="vendi^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vendĭtārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, a false read. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 103</bibl>; v. Ritschl ad h. l.</entryFree>
venditatio: <entryFree id="n50404" type="main" key="vendi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vendĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vendito, an offering for sale; hence, trop.</etym>, <sense id="n50404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a specious display</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a boasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vaunting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blazoning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin etiam mihi quidem laudabiliora videntur omnia, quae sine venditatione et sine populo teste fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venditatio atque ostentatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostentatio artis et portentosa scientiae venditatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venditator: <entryFree id="n50405" type="main" key="vendi^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vendĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boaster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vaunter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">braggart</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">famae nec incuriosus nec venditator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 49 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sallustianae lectionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venditio: <entryFree id="n50406" type="main" key="vendi^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vendĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>vendo</etym>, <sense id="n50406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a selling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sale; a vending.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50406.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">venditio alienatio est et rei suae jurisque in ea sui in alium translatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:10:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proscriptiones venditionesque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 44, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:56" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 56</bibl></cit>; cf., on the laws relating thereto, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 139</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">the title: De emptione et venditione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 3:23" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 3, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50406.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50406.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A thing sold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">antequam venditio transferatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:2:4:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 2, 4, § 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:23:11" default="NO">43, 23, 11</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goods sold</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:108:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 108, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50406.4" n="B" level="2"> Venditiones dicebantur olim censorum locationes, quod velut fructus publicorum locorum venibant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=376" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 376</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
vendito: <entryFree id="n50407" type="main" key="vendi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vendĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to offer again and again for sale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to try to sell</hi> (class., esp. in the trop. sense). </sense><sense id="n50407.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tusculanum venditat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct.
