Her.</author> 4, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agellum (opp. emere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscinas grandi aere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 38, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutationes stativorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordeum colonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 194, 36</bibl></cit>: non ego <cb n="VENE" /> possum, quae ipsa sese venditat, tutarier, i. e. <hi rend="ital">prostitutes herself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 41</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50407.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cry up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">praise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recommend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blazon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istius omnia decreta, imperia, litteras peritissime et callidissime venditabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:54:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 54, § 135</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 59</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">133: pacem pretio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:42:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 42, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera principis et adipiscendorum honorum jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 49 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam operam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 25, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii venditandi aut memoriae ostentandae causā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 30, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequium amatori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:43:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 43, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valde te venditavi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>have praised you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50407.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp.: se alicui, <hi rend="ital">pay court to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conciliate</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo modo se venditant Caesari?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>do they ingratiate themselves with him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimationi hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:58:section=132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 58, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod non florentibus se venditavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se plebi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 35, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se senatui litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:63:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 63, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50407.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To betray</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui perduellionis venditat patriam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 10, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venditor: <entryFree id="n50408" type="main" key="vendi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vendĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vendo</etym>, <sense id="n50408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seller</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vender</hi> (opp. emptor): <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne quid omnino, quod venditor novit, emptor ignoret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 12, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 58, 12, § 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1 sq.</bibl>: librorum, Schol. Cruq. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 4, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50408.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a bribe-taker: dignitatis vestrae, Cic. post. Red. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:4:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> 4, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venditrix: <entryFree id="n50409" type="main" key="vendi^trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vendĭtrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>venditor</etym>, <sense id="n50409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that sells</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vends</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:3:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 51, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venditus: <entryFree id="n50410" type="main" key="vendi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vendĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of vendo.</entryFree>
vendo: <entryFree id="n50411" type="main" key="vendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vendo</orth>, <itype>dĭdi, dĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>contr. from venum-do, venundo; v. 2. venus</etym>, <sense id="n50411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vend.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50411.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut hoc emptore vendes pulchre aut alio non potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juravistin' te illam nulli venditurum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum accepi, dote inperium vendidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum quidem hercle ne minoris vendas quam ego emi, pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vendo meum non pluris quam ceteri, fortasse etiam minoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 12, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam optime vendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:98:section=227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 98, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicit, quanti cujusque agri decumas vendiderit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 53</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">123 sq.: praedia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 54</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">142: fanum pecuniā grandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:26:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 26, 56</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vendĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot judicia, quae ex empto aut vendito aut conducto aut locato contra fidem fiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>sale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constat negotiatio ex empto et vendito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:38:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 38, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50411.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to sell</hi> or <hi rend="ital">give up</hi> any thing for money, <hi rend="ital">to betray</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum te trecentis talentis regi Cotto vendidisses ... quorum omnium capita regi Cotto vendidisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 34, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut modo se his, modo vendat illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:22:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 22, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vendidit hic auro patriam,</quote> <trans><tr>sold</tr>, <tr>betrayed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:621" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 621</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffragia nulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:78" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua funera,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to expose one's life for hire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:192" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam lucro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:75" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba sollicitis reis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:16:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ridere meum tam nil, nullā tibi vendo Iliade,</quote> <trans><tr>I will not sell it thee for an Iliad</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:122" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50411.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cry up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trumpet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blazon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">praise</hi> a thing (as if offering it for sale): <cit><quote lang="la">Ligarianam praeclare vendidisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vendit poëma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at tu qui Venerem docuisti vendere primus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:59" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te peregrinis vendere muneribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpura vendit Causidicum, vendunt amethystina,</quote> <trans><tr>recommend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:135" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 135</bibl></cit>.!*? The classical passive of vendo is veneo (q. v.), acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 365</bibl> P. In prose of the golden period, no passive forms of vendo are found, except the <hi rend="ital">partt.</hi> venditus and vendendus; but from the time of Seneca the <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">imperf. pass.</hi> are freq.; e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:2:section=7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 2, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:4:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:6" default="NO">34, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Had. 18, § 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 365</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
venedi: <entryFree id="n50412" type="main" key="Ve^ne^di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕdi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ou)ene/dai</foreign>, <sense id="n50412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of northern Germany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Wends</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 97</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called Veneti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venefica: <entryFree id="n50413" type="main" key="ve^ne_fi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnēfĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. veneficus, II.</entryFree>
veneficium: <entryFree id="n50414" type="main" key="ve^ne_fi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnēfĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>veneficus</etym>. <sense id="n50414.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A poisoning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de veneficiis accusare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tuis veneficiis remedia invenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 11, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:1:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 1, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 18, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:11" default="NO">5, 9, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:7" default="NO">7, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venefici damnari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deferre aliquem venefici reum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:6:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 6, 8 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n50414.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The preparation of magic potions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorcery</hi>: subito totam<cb n="VENE" />  causam oblitus est: <cit><quote lang="la">idque veneficiis et cantionibus Titiniae factum esse dicebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:60:217" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 60, 217</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quosque veneficiis abstulit illa (Medea) suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 150</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:41 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 41 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 2, 5, § 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veneficus: <entryFree id="n50415" type="main" key="ve^ne_fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnēfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>venenum-facio</etym>, <sense id="n50415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">poisoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poisonous; sorcerous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magical.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50415.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 2, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 3, 6, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chamaeleon,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 25 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percussor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:11:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 11, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50415.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnēfĭ-cus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a poisoner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sorcerer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wizard;</hi> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnēfĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sorceress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">witch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:19:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 19, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:105" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:16:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:13:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 5, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:8:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:71" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 316</bibl> (of Medea); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 6</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, as a term of abuse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 9</bibl>; Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 11, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venenarius: <entryFree id="n50416" type="main" key="ve^ne_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>venenum</etym>, <sense id="n50416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to poison.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50416.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calix,</quote> <trans><tr>a poisoned cup</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50416.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a poisonmixer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poisoner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. p. 291, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venenatus: <entryFree id="n50417" type="main" key="ve^ne_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnēnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of veneno.</entryFree>
venenifer: <entryFree id="n50418" type="main" key="ve^ne_ni^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnēnĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>venenumfero</etym>, <sense id="n50418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing poison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poisonous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venomous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 85</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕ-nēnĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = Scorpio, <hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 5, 39, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veneno: <entryFree id="n50419" type="main" key="ve^ne_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnēno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>venenum</etym>. <sense id="n50419.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To poison.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50419.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut spatium caeli quādam de parte venenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:820" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 820</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:50:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 50, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50419.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non odio obscuro morsuque venenat,</quote> <trans><tr>harms</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50419.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dye</hi>: quos (tapetes) concha purpura imbuens venenavit, Cn. Matius poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:9:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 9, 3</bibl>: venenatus, Mass. Sabin. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:27" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 15, 27</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 137</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnēnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I.), <hi rend="ital">filled with poison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">envenomed;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">poisonous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venomous.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50419.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">colubrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:479" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 479</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morsus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 58, 83, § 227</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est usquam venenatius quam in mari pastinaca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 12, § 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vipera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 1</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnēnāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. animalia), <hi rend="ital">venomous animals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 23, § 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50419.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">bewitched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enchanted; magic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 413</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50419.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla venenato littera mixta joco,</quote> <trans><tr>harming</tr>, <tr>biting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:566" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 566</bibl></cit>: eos vos muneribus venenatis venistis depravatum, <hi rend="ital">corrupting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dangerous</hi>, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:17:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 17, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">punctu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 196, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venenosus: <entryFree id="n50420" type="main" key="ve^ne_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnēnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of poison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very poisonous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Gen. ad Lit. 8:13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Gen. ad Lit. 8, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnēnōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very poisonously</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 6, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venenum: <entryFree id="n50421" type="main" key="ve^ne_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnēnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, orig., like <foreign lang="greek">fa/rmakon</foreign>, any thing, esp. any liquid substance, that powerfully affects or changes the condition of the body, <sense id="n50421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a potion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">juice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drug</hi> (cf. virus). </sense><sense id="n50421.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: qui venenum dicit, adicere debet, utrum malum an bonum; nam et medicamenta venena sunt: quia eo nomine omne continetur, quod adhibitum naturam ejus, cui adhibitum esset, mutat. Cum id quod nos venenum appellamus, Graeci <foreign lang="greek">fa/rmakon</foreign> dicunt, apud illos quoque tam medicamenta, quam quae nocent hoc nomine continentur, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:236" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 236</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 48, 8, 3</bibl>.—Obsolete, however, in this general signif.: qui venenum malum fecit fecerit, an old legal formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:54:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 54, 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritia pecuniae studium habet: ea quasi venenis malis imbuta corpus animum que virilem effeminat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50421.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50421.3" n="A" level="2"> In a bad sense, like <foreign lang="greek">fa/rmakon</foreign> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n50421.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A potion that destroys life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venom</hi> (cf. toxicum). </sense><sense id="n50421.5" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsius veneni quae ratio fingitur? ubi quaesitum est? quem ad modum paratum? cui, quo in loco traditum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 24, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">21, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:60:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 60, 165</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">61, 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 33, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis veratrum est acre venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 638</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 514</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 24, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50421.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">mischief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi> (rare, and not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">discordia ordinum est venenum urbis hujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:67:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 67, 6</bibl></cit>: regis Rupili pus atque venenum, i e. <pb n="1968" /> <cb n="VENE" /> <hi rend="ital">virulence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 1</bibl>.—Of bad poems, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:44:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 44, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:77:5" default="NO" valid="yes">77, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">humili veneno laedere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:171" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venena linguarum, Treb. Poll. Trig. Tyr. 30: lingua est suffusa veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:777" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 777</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50421.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a magical potion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">item ut Medea Peliam concoxit senem: Quem medicamento et suis venenis dicitur Fecisse rursus ex sene adulescentulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dira Medeae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:62" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Colcha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Colchica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:37:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 37, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 209</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 403</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui quodam quasi veneno perficiat, ut veros heredes moveat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 19, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod amatorium appellatur, venenum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50421.8" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seduction</hi>: aetas et corpus tenerum et morigeratio, Haec sunt venena formosarum mulierum, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intactos isto satius tentare veneno (i. e. amore),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit> (3, 3), 19: <cit><quote lang="la">blandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:453" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 453</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:309" default="NO">11, 309</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occultum inspires ignem fallasque veneno (i. e. amoris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 688</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50421.9" n="B" level="2"> In a good sense. </sense><sense id="n50421.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A coloring material</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dye</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paint</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">alba nec Assyrio fucatur lana veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 465</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 207</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 351</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n50421.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A drug</hi> used in embalming, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 691</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veneo: <entryFree id="n50422" type="main" key="ve_ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnĕo</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">vaenĕo</orth>), <itype>īvi or ii, ī^tum, 4</itype> (in the <sense id="n50422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> form, venear, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 365</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneatur, Titian. ib.: vaeniri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 28</bibl></cit> Ritschl: <cit><quote lang="la">VENIRI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4388</bibl></cit>; the <hi rend="ital">i</hi> of the supine short, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 907</bibl> P.; scanned long by <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> Hymn. 1, 21</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> VENIET, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 512, 14</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">imp.</hi> venibat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:47:section=113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 47, § 113</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf. inf.</hi> venisse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:4:5:20" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 4, 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4, 9</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>venum-eo; v. 2. venus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to go to sale</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be sold</hi> (used as <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> of vendo; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): oleam venire oportet ... oleo venibit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 146</bibl></cit>: auctio fiet; <cit><quote lang="la">venibunt servi, supellex, fundi, aedes, omnia Venibunt, quiqui licebunt ... Venibit uxor quoque etiam, si quis emptor venerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:96 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 96 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venibis tu hodie virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogis eos plus lucri addere, quam quanti venierant, cum magno venissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:39:section=89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 39, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei mandasti, cui expediret illud venire quam plurimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipia venibant Saturnalibus tertiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia veneat auro Rara avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondit, a cive se spoliari malle quam ab hoste venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:12" default="NO">12, 7, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber, quo questus est venire advocationes, venire etiam praevaricationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 13</bibl></cit> (14), 6: <cit><quote lang="la">adicis hos (agros) nongentis milibus posse venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 7:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mullum) missum sibi cum in macellum deferri et venire jussisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:42" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:27" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:8:15" default="NO">9, 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venerabilis: <entryFree id="n50423" type="main" key="ve^ne^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>veneror</etym>. <sense id="n50423.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthy of respect</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reverence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerable</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">venerabilis vir miraculo litterarum ... venerabilior divinitate credita Carmentae matris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnos quidem illos ac venerabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 408</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes eloquentiae (with sacrae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50423.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">showing veneration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverential</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">senatus in deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:15" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba erga deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venerabiliter: <entryFree id="n50424" type="main" key="ve^ne^ra_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕrābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>venerabilis, II.</etym>, <sense id="n50424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with veneration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">assensus his dictis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exceperunt victorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venerabundus: <entryFree id="n50425" type="main" key="ve^ne^ra_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕrābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>veneror</etym>, <sense id="n50425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">venerating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverential</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venerabundi templum iniere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venerandus: <entryFree id="n50426" type="main" key="ve^ne^randus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕrandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of veneror.</entryFree>
veneranter: <entryFree id="n50427" type="main" key="ve^ne^ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. veneror <sense id="n50427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
venerarius: <entryFree id="n50428" type="main" key="ve^ne^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. Venus</etym>, <sense id="n50428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venereal</hi> (very rare, for Venereus): <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>coition</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
veneratio: <entryFree id="n50429" type="main" key="ve^ne^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>veneror</etym>, <sense id="n50429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the highest respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veneration.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50429.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">habet enim venerationem justam quicquid excellit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:17:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 17, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">4: capita aperire non venerationis causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 6, 17, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter ingenitam illi genti erga reges suos venerationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:29" default="NO">6, 6, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:10:2" default="NO">5, 10, 2</bibl>; 7, 8, 4; 10, 5, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:12" default="NO">4, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:6:1" default="NO">4, 6, 1</bibl>; 5, 1, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:7" default="NO">12, 11, 7</bibl>; <cb n="VENE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:54:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 54, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50429.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, object., <hi rend="ital">the quality that commands veneration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerable character</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerableness</hi> (only post-Aug.): amici Alexandri ejus virtutis ac venerationis erant, ut singulos reges putares. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:1:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venerator: <entryFree id="n50430" type="main" key="ve^ne^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>veneror</etym>, <sense id="n50430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reverencer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domūs vestrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idolorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 8:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 8, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venereus: <entryFree id="n50431" type="main" key="Ve^ne^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕrĕus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Venus.</entryFree>
venerivagus: <entryFree id="n50432" type="hapax" key="Ve^ne^ri^va^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕrĭ-văgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n50432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj</hi> [1. Venus], <hi rend="ital">vagabond in love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">libidinous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolute</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 46, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venero: <entryFree id="n50433" type="main" key="ve^ne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. veneror <sense id="n50433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
veneror: <entryFree id="n50434" type="main" key="ve^ne^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n50434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [Sanscr. vankh, wish, pray; cf. O. H. Germ. wunsc; Engl. wish; and Lat. Venus, venustas], <hi rend="ital">to reverence with religious awe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to worship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50434.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50434.2" n="A" level="2"> Of religious worship offered to the gods, etc. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: adoro, colo, revereor): di quos nos colere precari venerarique soleamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:42:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 42, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venerari et colere deos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auguste sancteque deos omnes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 21, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum in precibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum (Epicurum) ut deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:21:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 21, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos in deorum numero (with colere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidem e sepulcro pro deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:40:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 40, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Larem Farre pio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:745" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 745</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestatem naturae deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50434.3" n="B" level="2"> With men or things as objects, <hi rend="ital">to revere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">do homage to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honor</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quin omne humanum genus secundum deos nomen Romanum veneretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 17, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneratur illos populus idem colitque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:41:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Satrium utque Pomponium venerebamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic patris sic mariti memoriam venerari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes qui aliquid in studiis faciunt venerari studeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 31, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectacula edentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut humilitas amplitudinem venerari debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canos ejus et annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>, ext. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">principes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:5:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquorum curam diligentiamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Augustum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:51" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se (scribentes),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 263</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50434.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to ask reverently</hi> for any thing, <hi rend="ital">to beseech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">implore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beg</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entreat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supplicate;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quisquis est deus, veneror, Ut nos ex hac aerumnā miseras eximat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. prol. 8</bibl>; cf. an old formula of prayer in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 7</bibl>: qui multa deos venerati sint contra ejus salutem, Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil horum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tu supplicibus me sis venerata tabellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit> (3, 13), 33.!*? </sense><sense id="n50434.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat, form <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕro</orth>, āre: <cit><quote lang="la">saluto te, vicine Apollo, veneroque te, Ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut venerem Lucinam meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50434.6" n="2" level="3"> Veneror, as passive, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 257, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 17, 1</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">Ceres, Hor, S. 2, 2, 124: Sibylla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 460</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 794</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n50434.7" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕ-nĕrandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">worthy of veneration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">VENERANDISSIMI CAESARES,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 209, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 38, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50434.8" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">with veneration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverently</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">adorant omnes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. Judic. Dom. 184</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 5, 432</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veneti: <entryFree id="n50435" type="main" key="Ve^ne^ti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕti</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Hĕnĕti</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n50435.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people in</hi> Gallia Togata, in the mod. <hi rend="ital">Venetian territory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 2, 2, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:606 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 606 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n50435.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n50435.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Veneti</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Venetian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:88:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 88, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eridanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:12:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: Mantua, Sid. poët. Ep. 9, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence also, Vergilius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50435.3" n="b" level="4"> (Perh. taken from the color of the sea on the coast.) <hi rend="ital">Sea-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bluish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cucullus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:170" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:74:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 74, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conditura (piscium in marinā aquā coctorum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 24</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50435.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Factio, <hi rend="ital">the party clothed in blue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Blues</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl>.—Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕ-nĕtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Blue faction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:46:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 46, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:23" default="NO">10, 48, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:131:1" default="NO">14, 131, 1</bibl>; v. factio.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕtĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the adherents of the Blues</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Blues</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1075, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50435.5" n="(g)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕtus lăcus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="VENI" /> <hi rend="ital">portion of the lake of Constance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 2, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50435.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Veneti</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 18, 22, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:27" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:76:2 al" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 76, 2 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50435.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people of</hi> Gallia Lugdunensis, <hi rend="ital">in the vicinity of the mod. Vannes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 18, 32, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7</bibl> sq.; 3, 16 sq.; 7, 75; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 5</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n50435.8" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Veneti</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50435.9" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕ-nĕtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Veneti</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Venetic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50435.10" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people of northern Germany</hi>, = Venedi.</sense></entryFree>
venetulani: <entryFree id="n50436" type="main" key="Ve^ne^tu^la_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕtŭlāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an extinct people of Latium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venia: <entryFree id="n50437" type="main" key="ve^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>akin to veneror, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n50437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">complaisance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indulgence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obliging disposition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mercy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favor</hi> (class.; cf. indulgentia), most usual in the phrase veniam dare, <hi rend="ital">to grant a favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to comply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consent.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50437.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: Jane, Juppiter, Mars pater, etc. ... vos precor, veneror, veniam peto feroque uti populo Romano Quiritium vim victoriamque prosperetis, an old formula of prayer in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Jove Opt. Max. ceterisque dis pacem ac veniam peto precorque ab iis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeso a vobis, ut in hac causā mihi detis hanc veniam, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">precor hanc veniam supplici des, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dabis hanc veniam, mi frater, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar tibi petenti veniam non dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">datur haec venia antiquitati, ut miscendo humana divinis, primordia urbium augustiora faciat, Liv. prooem. § 7: mi gnate, da veniam hanc mihi: reduc illam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremam hanc oro veniam, miserere sororis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">datur petentibus venia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniam petenti dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:48" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniam quoque a deis spei alicujus audacioris petimus, in sinum spuendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniam mihi quam gravate pater dedit de Chrysalo!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum data esset venia ejus diei,</quote> <trans><tr>when indulgence had been granted for that day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 17, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobile illud nepenthes oblivionem tristitiae veniamque afferens,</quote> <trans><tr>a complaisant</tr>, <tr>mild disposition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 2, 5, § 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50437.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Permission</hi> to do any thing, esp. In phrases: veniam petere (poscere) and veniam dare; <cit><quote lang="la">veniā petitā puerum ad canendum ante tibicinem cum statuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere veniam legatis mittendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniam dicendi ante alios exposcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">datā veniā seducit filiam ac nutricem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 48, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the context: qui censerent, dandam ceteris veniam talium conjugiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50437.3" n="C" level="2"> Bonā veniā or cum bonā veniā. </sense><sense id="n50437.4" n="1" level="3"> With audire, <hi rend="ital">kindly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without prejudice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonā veniā me audies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:21:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 21, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vos oro atque obsecro, judices, ut attente bonāque cum veniā verba mea audiatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum bonā veniā se auditurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum bonā veniā, quaeso, audiatis id quod invitus dico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 17, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50437.5" n="2" level="3"> With verbs of saying (mostly parenthet.), <hi rend="ital">by your good leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with your permission</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without offence</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi vero (bonā veniā hujus optimi viri dixerim) tu, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or 1, 57, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonā hoc tuā veniā dixerim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div 1, 15, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atqui, frater, bonā tuā veniā dixerim ista sententia maxime fallit imperitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:15:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonā veniā vestrā liceat, etc., Liv 6, 40, 10: primum abs te hoc bonā veniā peto ... mihi ut respondeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oravit etiam bonā veniā Quirites, ne quis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 41, 3</bibl></cit>.—Rarely veniā alone: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem ex his, quos eduxeram mecum (veniā sit dicto) ibi amisi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 46</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50437.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">forbearance</hi> in view of any wrong that has been done, <hi rend="ital">forgiveness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pardon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remission</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venia est poenae meritae remissio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">errati veniam impetrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem veniamque impetrare a victoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 45, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniam et impunitatem dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 11, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cui non apud senatum ... maximorum scelerum venia ulla ad ignoscendum duci possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:41:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 41, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:37:131" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 37, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui errato nulla venia, recte facto exigua laus proponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cede deae, veniamque tuis, temeraria, dictis Supplice voce roga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 78</bibl>: aliquem veniā donare <pb n="1969" /> <cb n="VENI" /> in praeteritum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniā dignus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">legere cum veniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 72</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
veniabilis: <entryFree id="n50438" type="main" key="ve^ni^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>venia, II.</etym>, <sense id="n50438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pardonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venial</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 943</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> adv. Avar. 4, 8</bibl>; cf. the foll. article.</sense></entryFree>
venialis: <entryFree id="n50439" type="main" key="ve^ni^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>venia</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n50439.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Gracious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 333</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50439.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pardonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista translatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam errores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venilia: <entryFree id="n50440" type="gloss" key="ve^ni_li^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnīlĭa</orth> <itype>unda est quae ad litus venit</itype>, Varr. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 22.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50441" type="main" key="Ve^ni_li^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnīlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several sea-nymphs.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50441.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The mother of Turnus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50441.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of Janus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 334</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venio: <entryFree id="n50442" type="main" key="ve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>vēni, ventum, 4</itype> (<sense id="n50442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> venibo, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 508, 23</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> venibat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 47</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> sync. venientum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 434</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 755</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root gā, go; Zend root gā, gam, go; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*b*a-, bai/nw</foreign>; Lat. ar-biter, venio; Goth. quiman; O. H. Germ. quëman, koman; Engl. come; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 466" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 466</bibl></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to come</hi> (cf. accedo). </sense><sense id="n50442.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc, cujus jussu venio et quam ob rem venerim, Dicam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veni, vidi, vici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 37</bibl></cit>: imus, venimus, videmus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritimus hostis ante adesse potest quam quisquam venturum esse suspicari queat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venio ad macellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut veni ad urbem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupio, te ad me venire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi si spatium fuerit in Tusculanum veniendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato ... cum venerat ad se in Sabinos,</quote> <trans><tr>had come home</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:28:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 28, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia nudius quartus venimus in Cariam ex Indiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexto die Delum Athenis venimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam fato profugus, Laviniaque venit Litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulum antiquae Cereris sedemque sacratam Venimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 743</bibl></cit> (cf. devenio): <cit><quote lang="la">vin' ad te ad cenam veniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercator venit huc ad ludos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo ad praetorem deplorabundus venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ego te derisum venio neque derideo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad istum emptum venerunt illum locum senatorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:50:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 50, § 124</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parasitus modo venerat aurum petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non nos Libycos populare penates Venimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 528</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of inanimate subjects: navis huc ex portu Persico Venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">denique in os salsi venit umor saepe saporis, Cum mare vorsamur propter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aër) Per patefacta venit penetratque foramina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:891" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 891</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(speculi imago) Dum venit ad nostras acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub aspectum venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:87:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 87, 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in conspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in conspectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:48" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebris vox mihi ad aures venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in Italiā te moraturum, dum tibi litterae meae veniant,</quote> <trans><tr>reaches you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: hereditas unicuique nostrum venit, <hi rend="ital">comes</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">descends to each of us</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:26:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 26, 74</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic Verres hereditatem sibi venisse arbitratus est, quod in ejus regnum ac manus venerat is, quem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 62</bibl></cit>: hic segetes, illic veniunt felicius uvae, <hi rend="ital">come forth</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">grow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 54</bibl>;
