venusia: <entryFree id="n50480" type="main" key="Ve^nu^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnŭsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the borders of Apulia and Lucania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of the poet Horace</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Venosa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14, 6</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnŭsīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Venusia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Venusian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Horace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucerna,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the poetry of Horace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:51" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 51</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕ-nŭsīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Venusia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Venusians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venustas: <entryFree id="n50481" type="main" key="ve^nustas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnustas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. Venus</etym>, <sense id="n50481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loveliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comeliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beauty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attractiveness</hi>, etc. (syn.: pulchritudo, formositas). </sense><sense id="n50481.1" n="I" level="1"> Of the body: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pulchritudinis duo genera sint, quorum in altero venustas sit, in altero dignitas, venustatem muliebrem ducere debemus, dignitatem virilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 36, 130</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 30, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venustas et pulchritudo corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voltus quantam affert tum dignitatem, tum venustatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 18, 60</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">signa eximiā venustate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capitolii fastigium illud non venustas sed necessitas ipsa fabricata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:46:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 46, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50481.2" n="II" level="1"> Of the mind: <cit><quote lang="la">homo affluens omni lepore et venustate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oratoris est) agere cum dignitate ac venustate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi vis egregia, summā festivitate et venustate conjuncta profuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 57, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comprobari cum dignitate tum etiam venustate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 12, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:118" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:66" default="NO">9, 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:72" default="NO">9, 3, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:20:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui quidem omnes mores ad venustatem valent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem pulchrum et venustatis plenum,</quote> <trans><tr>pleasantness</tr>, <tr>pleasure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quis me fortunatior, venustatisque adeo plenior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoenitates omnium venerum atque venustatum affero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venuste: <entryFree id="n50482" type="main" key="ve^nuste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnustē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. venustus <sense id="n50482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
venusto: <entryFree id="n50483" type="main" key="ve^nusto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnusto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>venustus</etym>, <sense id="n50483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make lovely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautify</hi>: se unguentis, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> p. 565, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ideo primo fecit (fidem) deus, postea venustavit, Ambros. Hexaëm. 1, 7, 27: miracula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Luc. 2, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venustulus: <entryFree id="n50484" type="main" key="ve^nustu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnustŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n50484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">lovely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delightful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. Idyll. 4</bibl></cit> praem.</sense></entryFree>
venustus: <entryFree id="n50485" type="main" key="ve^nustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. Venus</etym>, <sense id="n50485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lovely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">graceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegant</hi>, etc. (syn.: pulcher, formosus, speciosus). </sense><sense id="n50485.1" n="I" level="1"> Physically: <cit><quote lang="la">species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestus et motus corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:55:203" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 55, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:89:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 89, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diva venustissima Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">sphaera venustior et nobilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sirmio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 31, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectus figurationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50485.2" n="II" level="1"> Mentally: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecus facilis et valde venustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:28:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 28, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerumque dolor etiam venustos facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: venustum<cb n="VERA" />  esse, quod cum gratiā quādam et venere dicatur apparet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(genus dictionis) sententiosum et argutum, sententiae concinnae et venustae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:325" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 95, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(antiqua comoedia) grandis et elegans et venusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 61</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines venustiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe venustiora omnia in respondendo quam in provocando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">repercutiendi genus venustissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 46</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnustē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">charmingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gracefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautifully</hi>: venuste cecidisse, <hi rend="ital">most delightfully</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere mimiambos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 21, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hispanus hunc colorem venustius (adhibuit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:1:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: quibus venustissime Curio respondit, se, etc., Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia venustissime fingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vepallidus: <entryFree id="n50486" type="hapax" key="ve_palli^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vē-pallĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n50486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very pale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very pallid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 129</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vepraticus: <entryFree id="n50487" type="hapax" key="ve_^pra_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vē^prātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vepres</etym>, <sense id="n50487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a thorn-bush</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:1:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
veprecula: <entryFree id="n50488" type="main" key="ve_^pre_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vē^prēcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little thorn-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brier - bush</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa ex vepreculis extracta nitedula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:33:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 33, 72</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: vipera est in vepreculā, <hi rend="ital">there's a viper in the bush</hi>, of a hidden danger, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 231, 13</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 130 Rib.; cf.: latet anguis in herba).</sense></entryFree>
vepres: <entryFree id="n50489" type="main" key="ve_^pres"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vē^pres</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vē^pris</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vĕper</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, and more usu. in the <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕpres</orth>, <itype>ium</itype> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> veprum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:44" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 44</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n50489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 62</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. 1, pp. 460, 678), <hi rend="ital">a thorn-bush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brier-bush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bramble-bush</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n50489.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: ARBORES, VITES, VEPRES, SENTES, S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 129" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcrum septum undique et vestitum vepribus et dumetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 64</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 271</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 444</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 645</bibl>; * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> veprum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:44" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 3</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter vepres rosae nascuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50489.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing. nom.</hi> vepres, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 613</bibl> P.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> hunc veprem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 21, 37, § 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veprem et spinam vorabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 9, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">27, 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> vepre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 628</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vepretum: <entryFree id="n50490" type="main" key="ve_^pre_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vē^prētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vepres</etym>, <sense id="n50490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thornhedge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bramble-thicket</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:32:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 32, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ver: <entryFree id="n50491" type="main" key="ve_r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēr</orth>, <itype>vēris</itype> (<case>abl.</case> veri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:129" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 129</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/ar, h)=r</foreign>, i. e. <foreign lang="greek">vhr</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n50491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the spring.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50491.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 9</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:28:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 1, 28, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 737</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 19, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vere novo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo vere,</quote> <trans><tr>at the beginning of spring</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 2</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">vere prius flores, aestu numerabis aristas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:57" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50491.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the productions of spring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum breve Cecropiae ver populantur apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:14:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.—So esp. freq., ver sacrum, <hi rend="ital">a special offering presented from the firstlings of spring</hi>, which it was customary to vow in critical circumstances: <cit><quote lang="la">ver sacrum vovendi mos fuit Italis. Magnis enim periculis adducti vovebant, quaecumque proximo vere nata essent apud se animalia immolaturos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=379" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 379</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. id. s. v. Mamertini, p. 158; id. s. v Sacrani, p. 321; Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 522, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver sacrum vovendum, si bellatum prospere esset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 9, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the votive formula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 44, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 44, 1</bibl> sqq. Weissenb. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:4:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 4, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50491.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the spring-time of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">youth</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">jucundum cum aetas florida ver ageret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veraciter: <entryFree id="n50492" type="main" key="ve_ra_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. verax <sense id="n50492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
veragri: <entryFree id="n50493" type="main" key="Vera_^gri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Verā^gri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <hi rend="ital">on the Pennine Alps</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veratrix: <entryFree id="n50494" type="spur" key="ve_ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, a false read. for veteratrix, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 230</bibl>.</entryFree>
veratrum: <entryFree id="n50495" type="main" key="ve_ra_trum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērātrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n50495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hellebore</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 21, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:5:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:12 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 12 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 640</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:51" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verax: <entryFree id="n50496" type="main" key="ve_rax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>verus</etym>, <sense id="n50496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speaking truly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">true</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veracious</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">si eris verax, tuā ex re facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oraculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:19:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 19, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:41" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 79</bibl></cit>: visa quietis tranquilla atque veracia, <cb n="VERB" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 29, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 89</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vosque veraces cecinisse Parcae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:25" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herodotum cur veraciorem ducam Ennio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 56, 116</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veracissima promissio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vērācĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">truly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veraciously</hi> (opp. simulatorie), Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1010</bibl> P.; Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 4; 6, 10; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 56, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 17, 1</bibl>: Platonem acutius atque veracius intellexisse, Aug. Civ. Dei, 8, 4; 5, 8.</sense></entryFree>
verbalis: <entryFree id="n50497" type="main" key="verba_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>verbum</etym>, <sense id="n50497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wordy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verbal.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50497.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">horrea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae mulierum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n50497.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in gram., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to verbs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verbal</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 128</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 310</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
verbannus: <entryFree id="n50498" type="main" key="Verbannus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Verbannus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a lake in Upper Italy</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lago Maggiore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 224</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 19, 23, § 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verbascum: <entryFree id="n50499" type="main" key="verbascum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbascum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n50499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mullein</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 10, 73, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:23" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 4, 11, § 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verbeia: <entryFree id="n50500" type="gloss" key="Verbeia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Verbeia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess worshipped by the Gauls and Britons</hi>, perh. = VICTORIA, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 89, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1017, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verbena: <entryFree id="n50501" type="main" key="verbe_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (v. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 3, 11</bibl>); usually in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">verbēnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foliage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herbage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the leaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twigs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and branches</hi> of laurel, olive, or myrtle, <hi rend="ital">cypress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tamarisk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred boughs</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">verbenas vocamus omnes frondes sacratas, ut est laurus, oliva vel myrtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 12, 120</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Verg. E. 8, 65</bibl>, where is given the derivation, a viriditate; <cit><quote lang="la">such boughs were borne by the fetiales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 24, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:43:3" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 43, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 2, 3, § 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbenā tempora vincti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 12, 120</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">by priests suing for protection,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:50:section=110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 50, § 110</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and were used in sacrifices and other religious acts,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 19, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 242</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 36, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50501.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A class of plants used in medicine as cooling remedies</hi>, including the olive, myrtle, ivy, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 10, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verbenaca: <entryFree id="n50502" type="main" key="verbe_na_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbēnāca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> hierabotane, <hi rend="ital">vervain</hi>: Verbena officinalis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 59, § 105</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verbenarius: <entryFree id="n50503" type="hapax" key="verbe_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>verbenae</etym>, <sense id="n50503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who bears the sacred boughs;</hi> of the fetiales, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 2, 3, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verbenatus: <entryFree id="n50504" type="hapax" key="verbe_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbēnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crowned with a wreath of sacred boughs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbenatum infulatumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
verber: <entryFree id="n50505" type="main" key="verber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verber</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype> (<case>nom.</case>, <case>dat.</case>, and <sense id="n50505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. sing.</hi> do not occur, and the <number>sing.</number> in gen. very rarely; Neue, Formenl. 1, p. 476), <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a lash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scourge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rod</hi> (syn.: scutica, flagrum), </sense><sense id="n50505.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare; perh. not in Cic., but cf. in II. B.). </sense><sense id="n50505.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.: Tr.</hi> Quid me fiet nunc jam? <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Verberibus caedere, lutum, pendens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verberibus caedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentem nudari jubet verberaque adferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbera saetosa movebat arator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 25; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 19:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 19, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50505.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi instant verbere torto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebus equos stimuloque domans et verbere Saevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscendit equos Gradivus et ictu Verberis increpuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:821" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 821</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecora verbere domantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 12:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a top: volitans sub verbere turbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 378</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50505.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50505.5" n="A" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a thong</hi> of a sling and other similar missile weapons (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. lorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 309</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:314" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 314</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 469</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50505.6" n="B" level="2"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">a lashing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scourging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flogging</hi>, etc. (class.; syn. plaga). </sense><sense id="n50505.7" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50505.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignus es verberibus multis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi erunt parata verba, huic homini verbera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitto vincla, mitto carcerem, mitto verbera, mitto secures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:24:section=59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 24, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vinculis ac verberibus atque omni supplicio excruciare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 37, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:27:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 27, 64</bibl>; XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:113" default="NO">4, 2, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:40" default="NO">11, 1, 40</bibl>; 11, 3, 90; 11, 3, 117; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum positā stares ad verbera veste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:13:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergum foedum vestigiis verberum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post verbere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:143" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 143</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 172</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50505.9" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">percutimur caput conversae verbere virgae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 300</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 801" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 801</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50505.10" n="b" level="4"> Of inanim. things, <hi rend="ital">a stripe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stroke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blow</hi> (mostly<pb n="1972" /> <cb n="VERB" />  <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n50505.11" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turgentis caudae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:957" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 957</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:115" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">radiorum (solis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 485</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1104" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 288</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the strokes</hi> of oars: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis Verberibus senis agitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 536</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:493" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 493</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50505.12" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">remorum in verbere perstant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 662</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trementes Verbere ripae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adverso siderum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50505.13" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">lashes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strokes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumeliarum verbera subire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbera linguae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>chidings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 12, 3</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verberari verbis, convicio, etc., under verbero): fortunae verbera,</quote> <trans><tr>the strokes of fate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:27:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 27, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
verberabilis: <entryFree id="n50506" type="hapax" key="verbe^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>verbero</etym>, <sense id="n50506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worthy of a beating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verberabilissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
verberabundus: <entryFree id="n50507" type="main" key="verbe^ra_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbĕrābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">whipping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flogging</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Fragm. p. 30</bibl> Mai (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:v. 444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. v. 444</bibl> Ritschl).</sense></entryFree>
verberatio: <entryFree id="n50508" type="main" key="verbe^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beating.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50508.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagellorum castigatio, vinculorum verberatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:5:section=1" default="NO">47, 10, 5, § 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50508.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">chastisement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">punishment</hi>: mirificam mi verberationem cessationis epistulā dedisti, i. e. <hi rend="ital">satisfaction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amends</hi> (with reference to an expression previously used: verberavi te cogitationis tacito convicio), Q. Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 27, 1</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 26, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verberator: <entryFree id="n50509" type="hapax" key="verbe^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beater</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flogger</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 9, 38.</sense></entryFree>
verberatus: <entryFree id="n50510" type="hapax" key="verbe^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbĕrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si (aqua) e sublimi dejecta verberatu corripiat aëra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 23, § 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
verbereus: <entryFree id="n50511" type="main" key="verbe^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbĕrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>verber</etym>, <sense id="n50511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worthy of stripes</hi> (Plautinian): <cit><quote lang="la">caput = 2. verbero,</quote> <trans><tr>scoundrel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called statua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verberito: <entryFree id="n50512" type="main" key="verbe^ri^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbĕrĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n50512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [1. verbero], <hi rend="ital">to beat often</hi>, Cato, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=379" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 379</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
verbero: <entryFree id="n50513" type="main" key="verbe^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (old form verberit for verberarit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=230:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 230, 15</bibl> e leg. Serv. ad Tull.; <sense id="n50513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> verberarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 92</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>verber</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to lash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scourge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drub</hi> (class.; syn.: ferio, pulso). </sense><sense id="n50513.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Sum obtusus pugnis pessume. <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Quis te verberavit? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsare verberareque homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>; so (with pulsare) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 26</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">66: civem Romanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">parentem, servum injuriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 27, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos virgis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:43:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 43, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laterum costas ense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 727</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:94:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 94, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 5</bibl> proöem.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo firme verberaturi insisterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caudā verberando excutere cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 5, § 12</bibl></cit>. —Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">noli verberare lapidem, ne perdas manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50513.2" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">to beat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knock</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">locum coaequato et paviculis verberato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tormentis Mutinam verberavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquila aethera verberat alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:756" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 756</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verberat ictibus auras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundā amnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 141</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera (unda),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros nive (Juppiter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:390" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 390</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undas (Aufidus),</quote> <trans><tr>to lash</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 407</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">navem (Auster),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppim (Eurus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:639" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 639</bibl></cit>.—In a comic pun, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 177</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50513.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chastise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plague</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harass</hi> with words: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne me ut surdo verbera aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus convicio verberari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 26, 63</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verberavi te cogitationis tacito duntaxat convicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator in dicendo exercitatus hac ipsā exercitatione istos verberabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:21:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 21, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures sermonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50514" type="main" key="verbe^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbĕro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. verbero</etym>, <sense id="n50514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one worthy of stripes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a scoundrel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rascal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ain' tu vero verbero?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 128</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 187</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 19 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 6, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verbialis: <entryFree id="n50515" type="main" key="verbi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n50515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">verbal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">derived from a verb</hi>, Pompei Comment. (Keil, Lat. Gram. 5).</sense></entryFree>
verbificatio: <entryFree id="n50516" type="hapax" key="verbi^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>verbum - facio</etym>, <sense id="n50516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a talking</hi>, Caecil. ap. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 4</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 37 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
verbigena: <entryFree id="n50517" type="main" key="verbi^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>verbum-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n50517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who was born of the Word</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Christ</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 17</bibl>. <cb n="VERB" /></sense></entryFree>
verbigero: <entryFree id="n50518" type="main" key="verbi^ge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbĭgĕro</orth>, no <sense id="n50518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>verbum-gero</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to talk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoties inter nos verbigeratum sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 321, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
verbivelitatio: <entryFree id="n50519" type="main" key="verbi^ve_li^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbĭvēlĭtātĭo</orth>, v. velitatio.</entryFree>
verbose: <entryFree id="n50520" type="main" key="verbo_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. verbosus <sense id="n50520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
verbositas: <entryFree id="n50521" type="main" key="verbo_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>verbosus</etym>, <sense id="n50521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">multiplicity of words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wordiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verbosity</hi> (postclass.), Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 551; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 8:47" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 8, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verbosus: <entryFree id="n50522" type="main" key="verbo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>verbum</etym>, <sense id="n50522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wordy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verbose</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">verbosa simulatio prudentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 14, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">T. Livium ut verbosum in historiā carpebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:98:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 98, 1</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbosior epistula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expositio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 79</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbosissimos locos arcessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 31</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">verbōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with many words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verbosely</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 7</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:43" default="NO">4, 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:15" default="NO">5, 12, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verbum: <entryFree id="n50523" type="main" key="verbum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">verbum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n50523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> verbūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 8, 14</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>from the root er; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*e*rw</foreign>, whence <foreign lang="greek">ei)/rw</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">r(h=ma</foreign>, what is spoken or said; cf. Goth. vaurd; Germ. Wort; Engl. word</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a word; plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expressions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conversation</hi>, etc. (cf.: vox, vocabulum). </sense><sense id="n50523.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum nullum fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ullum verbum faxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui verbum numquam in publico fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:78:270" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 78, 270</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to talk</tr>, <tr>chat</tr>, <tr>discourse</tr>, <tr>converse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:65:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 65, § 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:8:20 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 8, 20 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spissum istud amanti est verbum veniet, nisi venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 77</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">videtis hoc uno verbo unde significari res duas et ex quo et a quo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:30:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 30, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum voluptatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:23:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 23, 75</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">vox voluptatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">libenter verbo utor Catonis (i. e. origines),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum usitatius et tritius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum scribere ... verbi litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:30:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 30, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero ullum (verbum) aut durum aut insolens, aut humile aut longius ductum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:274" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 79, 274</bibl></cit>: si pudor, si modestia, si pudicitia, si uno verbo temperantia (literally, <hi rend="ital">in one word;</hi> cf. B. 2. infra), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 73</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba rebus impressit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo etiam verbis ac nominibus ipsis fuit diligens (Servius Tullius),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid verbis opu'st?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec plurimis a me verbis dicta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to speak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: contumelia verborum, <hi rend="ital">insulting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">abusive language</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut verbis, quid sit, definiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:24:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 24, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba ponenda sunt, quae vim habeant illustrandi, nec ab usu sint abhorrentia, grandia, plena, sonantia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:15:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 15, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dialecticorum verba nulla sunt publica: suis utuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum delectum originem esse eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:72:253" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 72, 253</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">multis verbis ultro citroque habitis ille nobis est consumptus dies,</quote> <trans><tr>much talk on both sides</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:9:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 7</bibl>: accusabat Canutius Scamandrum verbis tribus, venenum esse deprehensum (literally, <hi rend="ital">in three words;</hi> cf. B. 2. b. infra), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 18, 50</bibl>.—Prov.: verba facit emortuo, <hi rend="ital">he talks to the dead</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in vain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 18</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: verba fiunt mortuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8</bibl></cit> (9), 26.—</sense><sense id="n50523.2" n="B" level="2"> Adverbial phrases. </sense><sense id="n50523.3" n="1" level="3"> Ad verbum, verbum e (de, pro), verbo, or simply verbum verbo, <hi rend="ital">to a word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">word for word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exactly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">literally</hi> (Cic. uses verbum e or ex verbo where the exact equivalent of a single word is given; verbum pro verbo of the literal translation of a passage; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>): <cit><quote lang="la">fabellae Latinae ad verbum de Graecis expressae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ediscere ad verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae modo expressa ad verbum dixi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnium mirifice ad verbum cum re convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 44, 99</bibl></cit>: quae Graeci <foreign lang="greek">pa/qh</foreign> appellant: <cit><quote lang="la">ego poteram morbos, et id verbum esset e verbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: istam <foreign lang="greek">kata/lhyin</foreign>, quam, ut dixi, verbum e verbo exprimentes, comprehensionem dicemus, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 10, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:8:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 8, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum de verbo expressum extulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum pro verbo reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec verbum verbo curabis reddere fidus Interpres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 133</bibl></cit>; cf.: ea sine <cb n="VERC" /> scripto eisdem verbis reddebat, quibus cogitaverat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:88:301" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 88, 301</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50523.4" n="2" level="3"> Verbi causā or gratiā, <hi rend="ital">for the sake of example</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for example</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for instance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis, verbi causā, oriente Caniculā natus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">M.</hi> Quid dicis igitur! <hi rend="ital">A.</hi> Miserum esse verbi causā M. Crassum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 22, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui verbi causā post mortem amici liberos ejus custodiant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 47, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut propter aliam quampiam rem, verbi gratiā propter voluptatem, nos amemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50523.5" n="3" level="3"> Uno verbo, or tribus verbis, or paucis verbis, <hi rend="ital">in one word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">briefly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50523.6" n="a" level="4"> Quin tu uno verbo dic, quid est quod me velis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetores, praetorios, tribunos plebis, magnam partem senatūs, omnem subolem juventutis unoque verbo rem publicam expulsam atque extirminatam suis sedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 22, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50523.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Brevin' an longinquo sermoni? <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Tribus verbis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax, te tribus verbis volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50523.8" n="c" level="4"> Sed paucis verbis te volo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 22</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis paucis quam cito Alium fecisti me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 123</bibl></cit>; cf. also paucus, II. B.—</sense><sense id="n50523.9" n="4" level="3"> Verbo. </sense><sense id="n50523.10" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Orally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by word of mouth</hi> (opp. scripturā): C. Furnio plura verbo quam scripturā mandata dedimus, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui verbo mandabo, quid, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulc. Gall.</author> Avid. Cass. 10, § 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50523.11" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Briefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a word</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam Caesar dicendi finem fecit, ceteri verbo alius alii varie adsentiebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut verbo adsentiebatur, aut pedibus in sententiam ibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 34, 7</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; 3, 40, 6; cf. also: rogatus a me etiamne majus quam dedecus, verbo de sententiā destitisti, <hi rend="ital">at a word</hi> from me, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 12, 28</bibl> Ernest. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n50523.12" n="5" level="3"> Meis, tuis, suis verbis, <hi rend="ital">in my</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thy</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">his name; for me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thee</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">him</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratum mihi feceris, si uxori tuae meis verbis eris gratulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 11, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulum quem ego militi darem tuis verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">denuntiatum Fabio senatus verbis, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:36:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 36, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n50523.13" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50523.14" n="A" level="2"> Verbum, in the <number>sing.</number> </sense><sense id="n50523.15" n="1" level="3"> Of an entire clause, <hi rend="ital">a saying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phrase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sentence</hi> (mostly anteclass.; cf.: sententia, dictum): <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Plus plusque istuc sospitent quod nunc habes. <hi rend="ital">Eu.</hi> Illud mihi verbum non placet: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nunc habes!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 95</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50523.16" n="2" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">a proverb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum est verbum, quod memoratur: ubi amici, ibidem opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 32</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod verbum in pectus Jugurthae altius quam quisquam ratus erat descendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 11, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50523.17" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">mere talk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mere words</hi> (opp. to deed, fact, reality, etc.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nomen): qui omnia verborum momentis, non rerum ponderibus examinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:8:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 8, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verbo et simulatione (opp. re verā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:58:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 58, § 133</bibl></cit>; v. res: dolor est malum, ut disputas; <cit><quote lang="la">existimatio, dedecus, infamia verba sunt atque ineptiae,</quote> <trans><tr>empty words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum sonitus inanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:12:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 12, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus (civitatibus) verbo sunt liberi omnes?</quote> <trans><tr>in word</tr>, <tr>in name</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:31:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 31, 47</bibl></cit>. —Hence, verba dare (alicui), <hi rend="ital">to give empty words</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to deceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui verba dare difficile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel verba mihi dari facile patior in hoc, meque libenter praebeo credulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 16</bibl></cit>, A: descendit atque Gallis verba dedit, i. e. <hi rend="ital">eluded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escaped from them</hi>, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curis dare verba,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to beguile</tr>, <tr>drive away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50523.18" n="C" level="2"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">a verb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristoteles orationis duas partes esse dicit, vocabula et verba, ut homo et equus, et legit et currit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=11 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 11 sq.</bibl></cit> Müll.; 9, § 95; 10, § 77 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 191</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50523.19" n="D" level="2"> In eccl. Lat. as a translation of <foreign lang="greek">lo/gos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the second person of the Trinity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Joan. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,023:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Joan. 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:19:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 19, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
